column2: Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: First and Foremost--apipex DOES help decrease appetite and suppress cravings. However, if you are one to become easily tolerant to medications, taking it a second round may not work. The ONLY thing that has made me abandon this medication after a hiatus, is the fact that, in my case, it caused SEVERE acne breakouts. I am not sure if it is because it acted as an accelerator metabolic wise, or if it is something that just affected me. Either way, when I began taking this medication again, the acne returned full force. I can say that in certain people, maybe this is rare, it DOES cause acne. In my case it began with skin peeling and increased sebum (thicker and heavier than normal). From this I have deduced that adipex does cause acne for some people; unfortunately I am one of them. This time, I stopped taking the medication and 3 days later my skin was clear again. I began taking it after my face was clear, and the exact same thing happened, beginning with the peeling. So, if you can tolerate the acne and the medicine is working for you, that's wonderful. Unfortunately, not only did it cause acne, but my tolerance to this medication kicked in immediately i.e. no weight loss at all. I've stopped the medication and have just used will power. The weight loss is slow, but hopefully, I can rid myself of the pregnancy weight without medication... Personally, the acne was too much for me.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I started Adipex P in June 2011. I weighed 283lbs. I am now at 235. From a size 22/24/3X, now in XL/1X, 14/16-18/20 depending on the clothes.I have had excellent results, but I also have tried to watch my calories and exercise.The only side effect I have experienced is constipation. You may lose some weight at first without changing your lifestyle much. If you think you can continue bad habits and the pill will magically help you lose weight, think again. It amazes me when ppl say once they stopped the pill they gained all their weight back.Stopping the pill does not make you gain weight, reverting to bad habits and eating to many calories and not being active makes you gain the weight back.As with most "diets"/weight loss, things have slowed down for me. I lost 16.3 lbs the first month, 10 lbs the 2nd, 8 lbs the 3rd, 5 lbs the 4th, 5 lbs the 5th which was in November. Since November I've only lost 8 lbs, but I have not gained. I have noticed that the last month or so it does not suppress my appetite as much as it used to, so perhaps the body does build a tolerance to it with long term use.

column2: AdamHo, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking adipex-p jan 9, 2012, At that point I was 309 lbs. First 3 or 4 days I felt I was on straight speed but it was not a bad feeling but it definately changed my sleep habits but that subsided after a week. I was not hungry but I stay on a diet of 1500 calories or less which for a man my size, 6'4, 309 and a verymuscular build that did not seem like alot of calories but i was not hungry, I was satisfied after every meal. Today is exactly 1 month after I started taking Adipex-P. I am 28 lbs lighter, my blood pressure is normal, I feel great so far. I go ack to the Dr. Monday and am going to get 1 more month supply and I am going to get off of it and maintain on my own. I am going for another 25 or 30 lb decrease then I will have achieved my goal. At 240lbs I am actually in great shape. Would I recommend this medication? You bet I would. It is a life saver. I did experience dry mouth as well. Almost every day but that was no problem. Best advice when taking this is to drink alot of water daily, take adipex on an empty stomach since it is an appetite supressant then eat a half hour later. Dont go without eating even though you are not hungtry. You can cause alot of other problems. If you are drug tested it does come up as an amphetimine but the values are so low the MRO will ask you about it so just have the prescription bottle handy and that should clear it up unless you are abusing it then you will fail the drug screen.

column9: I have been on adipex for three weeks and lost 14 lbs.  I experienced dry mouth - but like to drink water and need to increase my intake, so I do not mind.  I have a ton of energy and no other side effects.  I have always eaten healthy, for the most part, my biggest problem was portion control and snacking between meals.  Even healthy food and snacks can make you gain weight if you are taking in too many calories per day.  My craving for snacks has gone away. column2: mnv, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I took this about 2 years ago weighting 187 and got down to 142 pounds. After I stopped taking this, I gained all of my weight back. All in all, I would definitely recommend to someone wanting to lose weight!

column2: SlowNEasy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am a 35 year old African-American female and I have been on Adipex consistently since Oct 2010. I have not seen anyone who has been on it as long as I have to date. I started at over 330lbs and I am now at 266lbs. I tried everything and nothing seemed to work for me until I started using Adipex. I take 1/2 pill (of the 37.5 dosage) every morning before breakfast. This has been the best weight loss solution I have used to date. I don't exercise as regularly as I should however, I maintain an average caloric intake (1500 calories) and I take vitamins/supplements. My weight loss has been slow but that's mostly my fault. I believe that Adipex has the potential to help many people if taken in moderation and under a doctor's supervision. Be smart, don't kill yourself to lose a few pounds. I know of people who used Adipex (full strength) even though it kept them up all night and gave them jitters. I experienced these symptoms when I took the pill full strength (that lasted two days and I was over it-I immediately had my doctor change the dose to 1/2 pill). Just break the pill in half and the difference is amazing. If you lose the weight slowly and consistently, you will be more likely to keep it off. I am satisfied with my progress even though I know I could be further along if I were more disciplined. However, for the first time in my life, I haven't put weight back on. I can actually throw out my "really big girl" clothes for good. I started at a size 26 and now I'm a 18/20. Make sure your doctor monitors your blood pressure, and does your EKG and blood work regularly as required with the use of this medicine. I'm living proof that this medicine works. I think that is why my doctor has allowed me to be on it so long. I also recommend you have an allergy test done to see if you are eating foods you are actually sensitive/allergic to. I did and learned that I am sensitive to pears! This really helped improve my body's function. Hang in there, you can do this!

I also live on a farm and have worked hard it all my life and it was becoming harder and harder to walk up and down the hills looking for the livestock without becoming so out of breath I would have to stop and rest.  When I want something to eat that I know I shouldnt eat I have been telling myself NO! I AM NOT EATING THAT! It did help, but is now getting harder to say no.  when i went back to the doctor for my monthly weigh in I tried to tell him about my appetite, but he thought it was funny since I had lost 15 pounds.  I tried to tell him I wasnt joking but he wouldnt listen.  Maybe when I go back on 12/7 he will listen since I really havent lost that much more so far.  But anyway, so far I have done pretty good with a little will power that im afraid im losing.

column2: ArmyMedic, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am a 23 year old female. I am in the army so I have to stay within strict weight guidelines. I never had a weight problem until after I had my daughter, then went to Iraq for 15 months. I got the Mirena IUD before I deployed so I wouldn't have to worry about periods and birth control pills. (That was the last thing I needed to worry about.) During my 15 months in Iraq I gained 30 lbs. I deployed at 58" (height) and 115 lbs. I returned from Iraq 145 lbs. for someone my height in the army that is considered overweight. I do PT (exercise consisting of running, pushups and sit-ups) everyday and eat a healthy diet, but I wasn't losing weight. Everywhere I went in civilian attire people asked me if I was pregnant, and how far along I was. It really affecting my self esteem and my concentration at work. My supervisor was harassing me everyday at work about getting back within the weight standards, and even went so far as to call me fat and suggest chaptering me out of the military. I got tired of the harassment so I decided to take matters into my own hands and request Adipex from one of my providers, since I've heard so many positive results from it. I've been taking 37.5mg every morning at 8:00 for a week and have lost 5 lbs. I have constant dry mouth and a fluttery feeling in my chest. I have never had hypertension before or any other health problems besides asthma. I have no desire to eat anything all day, and when I force myself to eat, my food has an awful taste. So far I haven't experienced the burst of energy other patients have described. I have had insomnia at night though, and been late to formation twice. I'm looking forward to getting down to my ideal weight of 115lbs.

column2: Bill, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I began by breaking a 37.5 MG tab in half and took at 10 A.M. and 3:00 P.M. I had none of the possible side effects mentioned in class, but I still had to deal with being hungry in the evening hours. After my follow-up visit I was told to take a half tablet at 10 A.M. and a whole 37.5 MG tab around 3 P.M. This has worked wonderfully. I can actually work all day and faithfully keep to the 1500 calorie diet as prescribed by the maker of this drug. My firt month I lost 8 lbs and on track to do the same again this month.  My only concern I have is something I will discuss with my doctor on my next follow-up visit. I have what I call "urinary hesitation." It takes me forever to get started and one night took 6 minutes to complete a trip to the bathroom. I understand being a 66 year old male it takes longer because of enlarged prostate, but I think this is something the doctor should know.

column2: JennifernAla, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been on Adipex since April 1 and I have lost 56 pounds.  I have not taken it the whole time, I took the months of July and August off to see how I would do without it.  I started back in September to give me an edge because since I stopped taking it, I started crashing earlier.  I am now weaning myself off of it, only taking it 2 or 3 times a week to keep my body guessing.  I have been reading the reviews and I think that everyone thinks that it is supposed to be a miracle drug but it's NOT.  You have to change the way you live FOREVER not temporarily.  I have used the MyFitnessPal app and tracked my calories.  I have been walking 3 miles a day and now I am on Week 2 of Couch to 5k.  It is a lifestyle change.  If you want to lose weight, you need to clean out your cabinets first thing and get rid of all the junk.  Start eating fruits and vegetables.  If you stop buying the junk and bringing it in your house, you will be less tempted to stray. Another piece of advice is to plan our day's meals ahead of time.  It makes it easier to keep on course.  Good luck to you all.  Remember that you didn't gain the weight in just a month or so, so don't feel like you failed by not losing it all in a month.

column2: SwytDiva, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking Adipex on 10/11/11, I work our every week day (zumba, taebo and the firm). I started at 268lbs and am currently 252lbs as of today.  The first week I was still hungry, but the 2nd week I had 2 force myself 2 eat the 1200cals required per day.  To work with my afternoon hunger I always have a protein snack eg. Greek yoghurt.  I have to relearn how to eat the highest value of food to stay within the calories that I have allocated for the day. I follow the webmd weightloss program and it is godsend.  I started at a size 22 and I am currently fitting into size 18 in about 5 weeks...love it. I am trying to change my diet completely so that when I have to stop taking the med I am prepared.

column2: f.bowman1@verizon.net, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
Gail, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Well, I started Adipex on 10/13/2011.  It did not give me that burst of energy that I was expecting and i still feel hungry often.  I had to go off of it for a week because I had an illness and had to take prednisone for 6 days.  They did not want want me to take them together due to blood pressure concerns.  I went back to the doctor to weigh in yesterday, 11/9/2011 and had lost 16 pounds, so something is working.

column2: jessica8980, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a 28 year old female, and I started taking this on September 30, 2011. My starting weight was 307 lbs, and in the almost 6 weeks I've been on it, I've lost right around 20 lbs, and can definitely tell a difference in how my clothes fit. I have been walking 30 minutes a day, except recently, a sinus infection/URI has me down. My doctor told me to make sure I still eat, because it speeds your metabolism and needs the food to fuel it. I don't have the curbed appetite, but I do eat less per meal, snacking on fruits and veggies between my meals. I don't have the bursts of energy either, but I am motivated after seeing results to keep at it. I'm going to be getting an elliptical trainer in a couple weeks to maximize the pill/diet/exercise combo to get the most out of it while I can. I'm not sure how long my doctor will keep me on this, I'm sure I've got 2-3 months left, and hopefully by then my eating and exercise habits will be in full swing to continue the road to a healthier me. I drink a lot of water anyway, but when I don't this reminds me to drink more. If I don't get much sleep, I have a very disoriented feeling all day. I will post an update after my course of treatment is finished, but do far I will say I'm very pleased with my results!

column2: Hopey, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: I started adioex about a month ago. the first few days i felt great. i was not hungry at all, and actually lost 8lbs the first week. However, the second week I didnt have the same energy but it still supressed my appetite, then i had bad side effects. I got really bad headaches, and while i was working out i felt like i couldnt breath and then almost passed out. i stoped taking it after that and as soon as i stopped i was starving... I was also using sparkpeople.com so i was eating right but i was way more hungry when i stoped taking them...

column2: LorieD, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I first began Adipex because being on anti-depressants, I was gaining weight (which only made me more derpressed!) and was already too close to obese. My sister had recommended it. Her first month on it she lost 20 lbs. My first week I lost almost 18 inches overall (I don't own a scale) I thoroughly enjoyed the energy... my house has NEVER been this clean! ;D I was also surprised to find out (through WEBMD) just how many calories are burned in just 30 minutes of serious house cleaning - 292.32 - that beats Bowflex! However, the next week, the energy wasn't there... it was also that TOM and I got a cold... and the inches came back. Now I'm in week three and I'm back where I started. I'm VERY unhappy about that, but I'm not giving up... I started Atkins and I'm still deep cleaning my house, so we'll see!

column2: cindyyeo, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I gained 30lbs while being on anti-. I told my doctor that I need it to something about it. So he give me adipex and I have lost all 30lbs and have kept it off for over 6 months. I was very please.

column2: meghan, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: At first it worked great, but now I have a VORACIOUS appetite and just cannot stop eating. I have gained back 15 of the 50 lbs I originally lost, which does what?? Makes me depressed, that's what!  I kept increasing my intake of the drug to get the energy it USED to give me when I started. I do not have hypertension, thankfully, but will continue monitoring. I just want to be healthy. Get off your butt and do it on your own, being addicted to this pill is NO answer.  I might as well be out doing meth for goodness sakes.  I get headaches, have horrendous hip and back pain and I have read in some reviews that others have experienced this as well.  I hate the fact that I once again fell for the old "miracle in a pill" scam...the saddest thing is that a doctor gave me this prescription and I paid a LOT of money for my "treatment".  If you want to try it, go ahead, but PLEASE do NOT use it for more than the recommended period of time!

column2: newme2012, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It's too early for me to say. But like a previous reviewer I have not had any surge of energy. I'm disappointed about that. I work nights and was looking forward to it. My doctor he could increase it or give me a stronger version. we will see. its only been a day and 1/2

column2: Debradog, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started taking Adipex on Sept. 1st and one week later I've gained 2 lbs.  I also started Robert Ferguson's Food for Life program at the same time, thinking this would really kick start my weight loss.  I'm still in shock.  I've written down every thing i've put in my mouth this last week and keeping my intake at 1,000 cal a day, with mild excersize like walking and stationary bike riding.  I just don't get it, is this in any way normal?

column2: Sexy Redd, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a 29 yr.old black female & took Adipex 37.5mg once a day during a 12 wk.program.I had lost wgt.the traditional way(diet&exercise),but decided to try Adipex to piggy back this.The 1st day,I had euphoria(felt great),but after that,I was cool.This medication worked in helping suppress my appetite,but during the last month or so on this medication,the effectiveness seemed to wear off.I was proud of my 20 lb wgt.loss,but I gained it right back after my 12 wk.program & medication ended.Overall,my experience with this med was satisfactory.Just make sure u have a plan to continue the wgt.loss after this medication & keep your will power strong.

column2: Gail, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am on my second day of taking adipex.  I took my first pill at 6am Thursday morning.  I did not have an appetite that morning, but by the afternoon, I felt like I was starving.  I took my second pill this morning at 6am and it has not curbed my appetite at all.  I was so happy to get this medicine and thought it would be atremendouse help by curbing my appetite since I have very little will power to say no to food.  I am hoping it is just taking a few days to kick in.  Also, I have not had the burst of energy I heard other people say they had.  Has anyone else had this problem?

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am a 28 year old black female and weighed 230 lbs prior to starting Apidex. I started using the drug 2 weeks ago, along with a low calorie diet and daily exercise and have lost 15lbs. It definitely helps if you have always struggled to lose weight. I have not experienced any side effects thus far.

column9: I lost 30 lbs 7 mo.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Very effective in helping lose weight. I do suggest in eating something when taking to avoid the jitters.

column2: Special513, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on the meds for 1month now and have lost a tremendous amountof weight. At first I was kinda shaky but now I have so much energy and have lost 25pounds. I plan on stopping after I reach my goal. Discipline is the key to be set free from obesity!!

column2: crazyrena, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a 49 year old white female who has birthed two children. My diet habits were unhealthy. I was a night eater and grazer. I wanted to drop twenty pounds and adipex helped me do that. I went to see a dr and did lipo injections.

column2: AmandaJane, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I can't really review this product yet because today is only my 2nd day and to avoid the side effects, I am only taking half of a pill a day. And so far, no side effects. I am really hoping that I have the same success as some of you! I am 5'8 and 182 pounds. My goal is to reach 160 but would ultimately LOVE to be at 150. I haven't really changed my eating habits because they were pretty good to begin with. I started getting the shot as my birth control and gained 12 pounds in 5 month's. I have since stopped getting the shot, have started Adipex and am working out 4 days a week doing cardio. I really, really hope this works!!!

column2: WEDDING 2 go 2, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Today I was prescribed Adipex.  My BMI is 34.6My daughter is getting married in 6 mo!!  I have been exercising and Weight Watchers for a number of weeks.  Asked my doctor to prescribe to give me a kick and expidite my wt loss.  Keeping my fingers crossed!  Progress in a a week!

column2: Healthy Lifestyle, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking in May and have lost 35 pounds 3 1/2 months.  It works wonders but you still need to eat healthly and make a life style changes. I have not only lost the 35 lbs but have went down two sizes and loving it.  My doctor said it's time to get off of it.  I eat smaller portions and never was hungry while taking it.  It works!

column2: lindamae55, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: LovelyStacy, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a 28yr old female, currently standing 5' 8" & weighing 267lbs. I'm on 37.5mg tablet once every morning. I'm only currently on my 3rd day but so far so good :) I do still feel hungry but the hunger pangs aren't near as bad as it is without the med.

column2: soldierminutes, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am one of those people who really enjoy working out. Prior to my daughter being born & straight thru my pregnancy I worked out (yogo, swimming, cardio classes etc) Then, once I nestled down into motherhood & my husband being so supprtive, I began packing on the pounds. I went from a size 6 to 12! Then, the day I went into GAP and comfortablly slide into a size 14, I knew for ME, that was enough! This year my daughter turned 6 years old & I begged my doctor for something to give me a jump start back into working out again. After a series of tests, she prescribed this miracle working adipex to me & after almost 3 months, I was back in my size 6s again and I have regained my joy of working out 5 days a week.  My side affects (yet staying in close contact with my doctor!) have been occasional tingling fingers, once or twice I felt the tip of my tongue feel numb. I usually sleep with earplugs so I hear my heart beating irregularly sometimes, and the worse part is sometimes I get really dizzy. So because this is my final month of taking it, I've started to only take it 3 days a week to ween myself off it. Because I realize one important factor in this entire quest of losing weight; I ONLY OVER eat because of stress/nerves and my stress/nerves are diminished with prayer, working out and making it priority to carve out alittle bit of the day for ME.

column2: Kristen18, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took adipex for 6 months 2 years ago and lost over 40 pounds.  As of 3 days ago, I've gained back all but 7 pounds of what I lost.  I took it for granted.  I begged my doctor to let me go back on the pill for 3 months to jump start another weight loss.  Hopefully, this time for good!  He agreed to a month by month prescription.  To help my overall success, I have also rejoined Weight Watchers.  I have had success with it before.  I hope that the combination of the 2 together, will make it both easier to lose, and easier to maintain.Goos luck to everyone on their weight loss journey!

column2: Liz26, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this medicine for 13 days and have lost 9 pounds. I feel great! No side effects besides dry mouth. Will update in a week.

column2: Malvina, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: For the first time in 20 years I am finally loosing weight. It really cuts your appetite. I'm not having any trouble with side affects.

column2: shan, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking adipex now for 3 months and I have lost 30 lbs. I lost my first 20 in the first month, and then I stopped loosing, I was not eating hardly anything, I work out 5 days a week, and I was very frustrated. I have now increased my calorie intake and I have started drinking a protein shake for breakfast and lunch because I do not eat at those times anymore. I then started to loose again and have lost another 10 pounds, I have gone from a size 22 to a 18, I have not seen a size 18 in about 9 years so this is very exciting, and I feel wonderful!!!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've been using it for 3wks now. At first it worked great. Then recently it started making me very irritable in the evenings. I've lost 9lbs in the 3wks with eating good & alot of cardio. I'm going to stop taking it and continue working out and eating healthy and see if that makes a difference in my moods. I also got very emotional & depressed. Its nice to lose weight but I still want to be happy so its not for me.

column2: Anonymous, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I have been taking Adipex for 2 weeks now.  I have managed to lose 7 lbs which is amazing for me since it took me 9 mos of eating right and exercising to lose about 5 lbs prior to Adipex.  I was actually afraid to try a diet pill thinking that I would be spastic, have heart palpitations, insomnia, etc but I have only experienced the dry mouth and constipation...both are conditions that I can live with and manage.  I only take a half pill in the morning and a half pill in the afternoon.  I took a whole pill one time and felt way too jittery and my heart started racing. For those of you who have not appeared to lose weight, take the "water" pill/diuretic that your doctor prescribed.  Last week, I was disappointed that it appeared that I had only lost 0.2 lbs but I took my "water" pill and the next day I was down 2 lbs!  Women tend to retain lots of water especially during that TOM.  I have never posted a review before but I only gave this a shot because I read other people's reviews and it gave me the courage to try Adipex...this pill is literally changing my life for the better.  Like another poster said..."what do you have to lose by giving it a try...except for weight".

column2: mandapb27, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on adipex now for a week and I am doing a lowcarb diet with absolutely no fat meats, cheese, or eggs. I also exercise quite a bit and I work in construction where I am constantly keeping my heart rate high for atleast a few hours a day. I also drink 8 glasses of water a day. Needless to say I went in for a check up today and I LITERALLY have not lost a pound not even a few ounces! Maybe im doing something wrong because my step mom has lost 3 on adipex without diet or exercise. I wish I knew what to do but im lost.

column2: 55-64 Female  (Patient)
southern_belle, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed Adipex about 8 days ago. So far I have lost 10 pounds. My house has never been so clean and I feel great during the day. I have also found that jumping rope burns sooo many calories. I am 5'2" and 173 pounds, my goal is 145-150. I hope I can continue the good work and keep losing. The major side effect for me is dry mouth! It is terrible, but it keeps me focused on drinking water because drinking cokes kinda makes it worse. Other than that I am fine! Don't be scared to try something you think will make your life better. I never imagined exercising 30 minutes a day but I have been and I feel great doing it.

column2: Tia, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started taking generic adipex in May 2011 and Early June realized I had lost 11 pounds but the weather went rainy and I stopped my daily 2 mile walks, i foolishly stopped taking the adipex and began my old bad eating habits. I have 35 pills and am going to begin again tomorrow. plan to drink plenty of water a d walk  miles a day 5 time a week. when I started I was 209 went down to 198 in just 3 weeks. So i know it works, Motivating myself and I will hopefully soon be motivating you reading this;o)

column2: maredip, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This medication had worked, but is not for everyone. Use it as directed, only for the time directed, and do not stop it suddenly. I am currently weaning myself off of it, and have cut my remaining pills in half,and when I have a few left I will quarter those. I constantly had hbp while on these pills. yes, I lost about 35 lbs in the 3 months on them and relearned how to properly eat, but the time to use them is over. I would not recommend this drug for most people out there, and I would strongly recommend very close montitoring of anyone who uses it.

column2: happycustomer, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on Adipex-P for 3 days and I have lost 6 pounds already. I have a total of 91 more pounds to loose. The good thing about this pill, for me, is that it makes me pay attention to what and how much I am eating. I do get hungry but after I eat very little of the meal I am full and will have a bad stomach ache if I continue to eat. I will be on this until the end of September 2011 and I will put a final review. So far so good!

column2: Chickonabike74, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started using this drug about 1 month ago and have so far lost only about 10 pounds - however, I have noticed it gives me a "spring in my step" and I have more energy to work out without being overly tired or thinking about food all day long. I have been doing aerobic exercise as well as weight training. I'm told the reason the number on the scale isn't falling as fast as I had hoped is because I am also building muscle (5 lb. of muscle takes up MUCH less space than 5 lb. of fat). I have lost almost 2" from my waist and hips though! :-) My doctor says I can only take Adipex for 3 months so I plan to stick with it because it is helping me eat less and I like the energy it gives me. So far I have only experienced dry mouth, an occasional slight headache and dizziness, but that happens rarely.

column2: Big Daddy, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed Adipex-P in order to lose weight.  I'm also diabetic and have high blood pressure.  I'm a male, 5'8", and my starting weight was 268lbs.  In the 4 months I've taken this pill, I've dropped 40lbs, 4 inches on my waist, and I feel better than ever!    I was skeptical, but when I lost 15 lbs in the first month, it was such a great motivator.  Not only did my weight go down, so did my blood sugar and blood pressure numbers.  Ive now added exercise, I used to have no time, but since I wasnt hungry for lunch, I started walking instead and now have progressed to running to help bring the weight down faster.  Now I want to try to run my first 5K before the end of the summer!  As I see my doctor monthly, the visits have more been about measurement and tweaking my regimen.  Primary goal is to get below 200.  Ultimate goal is to get to 180.  Weight loss is a struggle, but this drug is great at getting you jump started.  Remember though, it's all about you and your motivation.  You CAN gain weight on this drug so work with it and it will work for you.  Some cotton mouth and occasional head aches as side effect, but they're manageable.  Rest and lot of water will take care of that and you need it anyway!  I have to say that Adipex-P is a life saver, literally!  It jump started me, but now that change is in lifestyle, not diet.  I've even got my wife and son walking with me in the evenings!  Good luck on your journey and if you're on this pill, work with it, keep at it, stay motivated and use people like me as inspiration to get yourself to your goal.

column2: Evangelist , 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Start to take adipex May 15 2011 start weight 295lb. When first start side effects light headed, dry mouth, dizzness, etc. Some slowly went away. This drug does give you energy and make you less hungry. But with any drug is an temporary relief meaning its not a lifetime fix. You are the lifetime fix you have to combine excerise and eat right. I have a gym at home where I do some excerising. I have completing change my eating habits with Ms. Hsu cleaning plan. you can purchase book at Health store I love it because it give you recipes with meal plans you can follow. Stay bless and encourage in yourself any if you dont loss weight right away. Determination and force will take you there. Shalom

column2: redd66r, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Very pleased. I have lost about 40 lbs. thus far.

column2: sunshine, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I like taking adipex I have to make myself eat at times yes I do have trouble sleeping but it's ok I work night shift I have lost 5pounds so far but I could have lost moore if i was eating right and working out more I plan on doing it this time around I like the way it make me feel. I have more energy! And dont wont to sit and eat all the time:-)

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started on 37.5 back on Feb. 27. I have lost over 30lbs but have worked physically hard exercising 5x a week. I have been just slightly jittery and have had dry mouth most of the time. A bit of insomnia also has happened. I am now at my healthy BMI and having to purchase new clothes to fit.I was very happy with the medication benefits. Lost my appetite at the beginning but seems to lose its punch later on. Seem to give me more energy too. You must learn to also control your eating behavior also, since you cannot use the drug indefinitely. In the end I am very happy with my results and am determined to keep my results now that my prescription has ended.

column2: TrayBaby, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Gave me a boost of energy and decreased my appetite

column2: sunijen, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

Have been at a standstill with my weight for about a month.  Hoping this med will help, as I need to lose about another 50 pounds.  No side effects so far.  Will keep posting!  Good luck to all of you out there taking this!

column2: mia, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: it has worked very well

column2: hoosiergirl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking Adipex on Feb. 4, 2011 and as of May 18, 2011 I have lost 26 lbs.  It's easy to take and I have no appetite.  I used to eat whenever I was bored, which happened often at night - right before bed.  Now, when I do decide to eat (several small snacks and one larger meal a day), I am satisfied with a very small portion.  I have lots of energy too.  The only side effect for me is not being able to wind down till almost 11pm every night.  And cotton mouth is a side effect, but hey, I needed to drink more water as part of my lifestyle change anyway.  I highly recommend this product for anyone who is looking for that "jump start" to losing weight!

column2: jmcargile, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: it works

column2: Jill, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started Adipex Sunday May 7, 2011.  I started with just half a pill. I now take 3/4 of the pill, eventually I may take the whole pill.  I have lost 6 pounds as of today.  I have had some minor side effects.  I find I am a little jittery, but nothing major.  It has drastically cut my appetite especially for sweets, I can pass up any dessert put in front of me.  I find it hard to eat sometimes and when I do, I can't eat alot.  I hope to find a balance with food, I am only taking the meds for 2 months then I will get off.  I know if I don't start eating normal that the weight will just come back on.  My mom is also taking it and she has lost 5 pounds her first week too.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Been on Adipexfor less than a week but I have so much more energy and have No appetite whatsoever... Prior to taking was know to be a grazer. Family & Friends have noticed the dofference. My one negative so far is I have cotton mouth that is so severe I have to have water with me at all times because I start choking. good luck to everyone

column2: sickofbeingafatty, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started taking this drug 3 weeks ago & I'm down 19lbs already.  Started out at 261 & I am 5'9".  I no longer crave or want sweets anymore.  No desire to eat them even when offered & I could never turn them down before.  No longer have a diet soda addiction and even stopped drinking coffee.  Didn't even intend to stop drinking them but the taste changed for me (diet soda tastes chemically & uber sweet) and now all I want to drink is lots & lots of water.  My appetite is non-existent & I actually have to force myself to eat something when I feel my blood sugar drop.  I haven't even started to work out yet.  I wake up early feeling refreshed, which I have never felt before being a grouchy morning person, but sometimes I do have trouble falling asleep.  I am having a problem with alternating constipation for 2 days then a day of diarrhea for 1 day after but that may be because I'm not eating nearly as much as I used to & my body is probably getting used to it.  Would have given it 5 stars if it wasn't for the gastric problems.  I notice I have a ton more energy daily.  I actively seek out cleaning around the house.  I am just shocked that I no longer crave junk food & the only things I will eat are healthy whole foods because everything else sounds & tastes gross.  I used to LOVE fast food, carbs & sweets.  Overall very pleased so far.

column2: Olga, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started 3 days ago, it feels very strange for me, I'm not hungry at all. I'm forcing myself to eat vegetables and lean meat, but become full really quick. I have absolutly no desire for sweets. It is such new feeling for me. Two month ago I bought 10 day weight loss package of prepaked low calories food from my gym: and I was always hungry, very weak and almost passed out in gym. I lost 3 lbs after 10 days and immediately got them back after was done. This time with the help of Adipex I hope I will have more success. So far it works great!

column2: Justrun1963, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started taking adipex (generic) on 4/9/11.  I started at 230lbs.  It has been one week today and I have lost 7lbs.  I'm so excited to see the weight loss.  I was already exercising and watching what I ate, but wasn't seeing any weight loss.  The first couple of days I did feel a bit on edge, but that has gone.  I do get dry mouth really bad at certain times.  That in itself makes you drink plenty of water and sugarfree gum or mints work well.  I feel like apidex does suppress my apetite well and I really have no cravings for breads sugars etc.  Hoping week two brings the same weight loss or better.  I will update next week.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on Adipex 37.5 once a day now for a month and have lost 23 pounds! I feel great.

column2: mccray35453, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was on Adipex last year (2010).  The first few days were amazing! I had energy to burn.  After a while, the effects wore off.  It did curb my appetite tremendously, but after a few days, it just quit working.  I was told by my doctor that I just build up an tolerance to them.  If you want to try them, good.  Not all people build tolerance to diet pills, prescription at that.  Good luck to you all.

column2: sidekick, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Started taking on Jan.28.2011, weighed 212, now at 183.On the first day taking and a couple of weeks afterward I was having chills, feeling very drowsy in the middle of the day, could not sleep at night. Have been taking a little over two months now those symptons are gone. Sometime have trouble sleeping at night. But for the better part it works good. curves your appetite. When I do eat I get full fast. Cant eat as much as I used too.I also experience the dry mouth. If you need to lose weight I recommend these pills. You still need to make healthy food choices, and exercise to get the full benefits.

column2: sweetmarehair, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Ive only recently started this medication, (I'm in my first week) It does seriously curb the appetite, Im forcing myself to east because I have ZERO desire to eat, but I also know that if I dont eat, the moment I do, ill gain back anything I lose. The first day was rough, very very tired, and so thristy, yet not able to drink much. We'll see how it goes. My neurologist prescribed it.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
AlmostThere, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am finshing my 3rd month on Adipex.  It has done wonders for my weight, my health, my shape and my self esteem.  I initially had a full physicial from my dr. and after my blood results came back fine we proceeded.  I also want to mention that first month prior to starting this I lost 10 lbs on my own my cutting out white flour and sugar.  Once I started the medication the first week I was wired and was constantly moving.  I had dry mouth as well, but outside of that no other symptoms or problems.  I started working out and monitoring my caloric intake as well and the first month I lost 15 lbs for a total of 25 lbs in 2 months.  The 2nd month I lost another 15 lbs for a total of 40 lbs in 3 months.  This is my final month and according to my scale I have lost another 11, but my weigh in with my dr. isn't till Friday the 8th, so we'll see.  I'm hoping to have broken the 50 lb. mark!  I agree Adipex is great, but it's more of a great took to help you loose weight and create a new lifestyle.  I've read/learned more about food and how it makes me feel over the past 3 months and also have learned to love going to the gym.  The energy from Adipex is NOTHING compared to the energy and personal accomplishment of having a good workout at the gym.  I truly feel that Adpiex has been a tool to learn how to eat and excerise properly and give me a jump start to a new life style.  I have another 25 lbs to loose before hitting my goal and I am confident with the new tools/skills I will be able to do that in the next 3 months without the help of Adipex.  Good luck to all and remember it's a tool to help, not a pill to fix!

column2: cheryl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This medication has been very effective for me.  I feel less hungry the majority of the time, and if I do eat more than I should for some reason, I feel very sick to my stomach.  I have lost 17 lbs in 2 months, and am almost at my goal.  I was not obese, but after considerable research and talking with my doctor, we both decided that this would be a good "jump start" for me to start losing those extra lbs.  I do take a rather high dosage of a common SSRI, which is definitely something that needs to be considered and watched closely while on this medication.

column2: jessica, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: it helps me not to be so hungry all the time.

column2: icats73, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on this med since November 2010. I weighed in at about 248. By my last doc appt. on Jan 22, 2011 I weighed in at 214. Losing 34 pounds sounds good to me. However, this has been without any exercise routine. My doctor has recommended that I incorporate exercise while taking this. I am a stay at home Mom for now (looking for a job), and I have two boys - one in school and one still home with me. My days stay busy so I am constantly doing something. But I guess I need to go for some 1 hour walks with my little one. He's 5 so he should be able to handle it. I need to work quick though, my doc said he's probably going to take me off of this med for about 3-4 months and see how I do not being on it, which makes me a little nervous. I really feel better physically. I LOVE the way my jeans are looking on me and I really don't want to gain the weight that I have lost, back. So, I guess wish me luck. I've got 30 more days of this and they will probably take me off - eek. Good luck to everyone else who's on it.

column9: I started taking it and within 3 weeks I broke out in a huge rash.  I went to a dermatologist and have tested positive for Lupus in 2 separate tests.  I am disappointed because the drug made me feel great but I have had to stop taking it cold turkey and hope my body recovers.

column2: BCGLAM, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took this drug about a year ago and decided that taking the pill and eating whatever I wanted and no working out would be the answer - wrong. I am going to incorporate exercise into my daily routine and I am confident that with a little push from this medication, a fairly strict [Weight Watchers is EXTREMELY flexible] diet and 30 minutes of exercise a day, I will drop more. I have experienced some insomnia, dry mouth and hot flashes .. But it is completely worth it.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started this medicine the first week September the doctor started me on half a 37.5mg pill in the morning and another half eight hours later. My starting weight was 290lbs. I have never been this big and I was truly disgusted with myself. I had so much energy for the first month I was constantly cleaning my house and offering to clean my neighbors house's I had so much energy. The first month I lost 14 pounds. I was so excited. THe second month i was still talking half a pill twice a day. I went through the month watching what I eat and walking and I lost another 9lbs. In November I went up to one whole pill twice a day. My next weigh in I was down another 10lbs. My latest weigh in was today abd this was the weigh in after CHristmas when they say most people fail and I lost another 6lbs. I also take a water pill every three days that the doctor gave me that seem to help. I am trying to lose 100lbs and I am almost halfway there I am so excited. This last baby was not kind on my body and I am glad I found a way to make it work. I sleep good but I was on ambien before I started the adipex. Big side effect is the dry mouth I suck water down all the time. I have had a slight increase in hair loss but I have thick hair so it really isn't bother me. Good luck to everyone out there that are just starting hope you have as good of experience as I have had.

column2: dhawth88, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking Adipex  on Aug. 18, 2010. i then weighed in at 180,>I noticed a change in my apetite the first day a took it... i acually did go throughh one whole week with out eating nothing at all, i couldnt even finish a bottle of water in 1 day, because i didnt feel hungry at all and everything seemed so nasty to me...so i did have to force myself to eat! the first mnth i lost 13 lbs. weighing 167! The 2nd mnth alot easier, and i was eating more than i had been the previous week... i lost 7 more lbs. weighing 160!... total of 20lbs.... the 3rd mnth seened to be the wrost becasue i started to get my apetite back, but i was trying to force my self not to eat becasue i didnt want my weight to go back up...somy next vist to the doctor i gained 1 lb back! :(...he told me to take 1 pill in the morning and 1/2 in the afternoon, and its still not working the way i use to be when i was taking 1 pill a day... so today, dec. 25.2010. im trying to mantain 160, and get back down to 140 by the sprig....so far i have lost 20 lbs in 3 mnths, and went from a size 15 to a 11...xl to a L/Med. i love  the results so far but i know i have to keep pushing..If anyone has any ideas, or recomendations please comment and let me know!! :) thnx loves!!!

column2: angie71, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i am 5'0 even and 39 years old. when i started Adipex at the end of October i weighed 176. i have high blood pressure  and high trigilerides so my blood pressure was controlled by medicaction and the trigliserides are controlled also my meds. when i went to the doctor for help she did blood work and found that my sugar and b12 was out of wack also. she put me on Adipex and recommended a diet plan,she recommended Weight Watchers because i really can eat anything i just have to account for it. i changed my eating habits and started power walking with a family memeber and when i went to the doctor yesterday(12-22-10) i weighed in at 148 with clothes on. if i weigh without close i weigh in at 145. i have never been able to stick with anything but since taking this medicine and doing weight watchers i have really worked at it. column2: mike_n_midland_mi, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: A friend of mine was taking this pill about a year ago and lost a lot of weight. I also am over weight and went to my doctor asking for this pill. They would not give it to me because I have heart problems. This year I have a new doctor, and asked to be put on the pill. My new doctor agreed but told me if I felt ANY kind of chest pain or anything out of the normal with my chest to stop taking it. I have been taking the pill for 6 days now. I started it on 12/16/10 and today is 12/21/10. I weighed myself today and I've already lost 10 lbs. I started at 245lbs and I'm now 235. I experienced not being able to use the bathroom (#2) for the first couple of days. After a couple days, everything is coming out just fine. I actually find myself using the bathroom #2 more often now then I have before I started taking the pill. I get dry mouth a lot. I drink a lot of water now. I sometimes crave it. I dont find myself hungry anymore really, but make myself eat a boul of cereal in the morning before I take the pill.  It is working just great for me for far. My goal is 190. Wish me lots of luck!

column2: jruiz9801, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 28 5'6 and weighed about 213 when I started taking this drug.  Ihave been taking this drug for a few months(3) now.  The first month I lost 10 lbs.  My clothes are falling off of me and I have bought pants in a smaller size.  I am only taking 1/2 a pill a day.  It does decrease your appetite and encourages you to drink water because your mouth is dry.  The only reason I rated it 4 stars for satisfaction is because I worry about side effects-such as high blood pressure, heart conditions, kidney problems, etc.  My blood pressure has always been normal, around 110/60.  Since taking this medicine my blood pressure has increased, around 125/85.  Although not high, if I started out with high BP it would probably be high right now.  Overall I like the drug and hope I can keep the weight off when I stop taking the med.

column2: done with plateau, 19-24 Female  (Patient)
column9: HELP! I'm 21, 5'3, 142lbs and my goal is 120. I started taking adipex about 3 weeks ago. I've been on the 1000-1500 calorie diet that the company provides and my doctor suggested. I rarely eat more than 1000 a day. in the first week and a half i lost 10 lbs, but since then, NOTHING! i know its been the holidays, but i tried very hard to stick to the diet and never went over about 1400 cals in one day. About 2 days ago i started increasing the amount of fiber and water im taking in. i walk my dog for an hour or so each day(i'm afraid to do any more because of how few calories i'm taking in)and i cant get off this plateau. here is what i'm eating each daybreakfast- 1 fruit, 1 starch, 1 milklunch- 1 fruit, 1 starch, 2 meatssnack- 1 fruit or 100 cal packdinner- 1 veg, 1 starch, 2 meatssnack- 1 starch, 1 milkI also recently started taking birth control about a week before starting adipex. i heard that this might make you gain weight but only because it makes you hungry so you eat more (which is cancelled out by adipex) or bc your bust gets bigger (nope, theyve gotten smaller since on the diet).Does anyone have any suggestions to get me off this plateau? I would suggest this drug as the effects work amazingly. i'm never hungry and i always have energy. the weird side effects werent that bad for me and went away after the first week.

column2: bettyb323, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking adipex in early May of this year. My doctor gave me the 37.5 mg dose that I take every morning before I eat breakfast. I have decreased my portions, drink alot of water, cut out soda completely, reduced sodium intake, reduced carbs, added more fruits & veggies, and exercise at the gym anywhere from 3-6 days a week from 1-2 hours each visit. I hope to reach my goal of 130-135 lbs by my birthday at the end of February 2011.

column2: DieselAngel247, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started on Adipex-P 37.5mg on September 27, 2010 and had my follow up appointment today October 25, 2010  I lost 15 pounds in 1 month.  My doctor said that was great.  The only side effect I have is dry mouth.  For me it totally cuts out my appetite, I don't crave any sweets ( my weakness )  I cut out sugar and salt all together, and I used Slim Fast for the times I didn't have time to make something.  I ate more fruits and veggies.  I also completely stayed away from soda.  I don't have any problems sleeping.  When your on Adipex you have to be seen by your doctor each month, the maximum time aloud on Adipex is 3 months.  Because of the risk of becoming addicted and other health risk that could develop.  After a few months you can get back on them, if so desired.   Because your only can be on Apidex 3 months at a time, the challenge will be keeping the weight off after.  I know for me it's like it puts a block on all my bad snacking and cuts out all my cravings.  I don't have any hunger pains for so ever, at times I have to force myself to eat something, even just drink a Slim Fast.

column2: LLanning, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking Phentermine in Mid August 2010. I started at 185 and would like to see 130. I only lost 5 pounds my first month, however it was a stressful month, car problems, lost my job. My doctor seemed to think that may have stalled it a bit. (makes sense) The first week or so I was jittery, more anxious and had no interest in eating! Those symptoms have tapered off and now the only side affects that I have are slight increased sweating during exercise & getting out of shower. Overall, It is working great, I really have to remind myself to eat. I did start feeling cravings/hunger around 3ish at the end of my first month, my Doctor then told me to try taking just a half of one at that time, so far so good. You really do have to change your eating habits and get moving, its no magic pill, but it does help significantly for emotional eaters and those whom just have major cravings! If you are feeling discouraged in the first week ot two, allow your body to adjust, as it will. I do have concerns about the risks in the future, heart/thyroid/glucose issues...however it was put to me this way "being overweight is just as, if not more risky". This should only be short term (no more than 6 months) Do only take this under the care of your doctor and listen to your body/symptoms, check your blood pressure a couple of times even in between appointments also. I monitor mine and log it each time. Be smart and be careful! Good Luck to each of you out there on your weight loss journey! Remember, this pill is just a boost to get you started! God Bless!! : )

column2: Sweatpea, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am on a healthy eating plan, since starting this medication I am down 40 pounds. I am one of those people that can eat a meal, then turn around and WANT more, and yes I am stuffed, not heatlhy! Since starting this medication, I eat 6 small meals a day, I am not hungry during random parts of the day. I am thristy, I do drink a lot of water and my Dr is monitoring my BP, I have to see her monthly and we pretty much do a physical each month, I am OK with that. I feel better, the clothes are getting bigger and I on the other hand am NOT, not a bad trade off! I'd rather buy clothes than a king size candy bar any day!ALWAYS talk to your Doctor, ALWAYS check your BP while on this medication. I am not only LEARNING to eat, I am training my brain to know when and what I NEED to eat... Saddly those are things I have forgotten over the years! Exercise is so much easier, I have started to run short distances, I was NOT able to do that 4 months ago! Baby steps lead to large leaps that lead to massive bounds... OVER ALL ... I AM DOWN, 40 POUNDS ... 95 TO GO, SLOW AND STEADY! GOD BLESS!

column2: Teamforce1, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Update, I have now lost 32 pounds while taking this medicine. I have been on it for 4 months. I am now fitting into clothes that I haven't worn in a few years. I have gone from a size 16 to a size 12. I still want to lose another 30 pounds, so I'm half way there! I have put alot of hard work into this as well. I do LOTS of walking, it is great for your heart and body and it is a great stress reliever and mood lifter. I just grab my mp3 and just go. I try to eat right and watch what I put in my mouth, of course, I give myself a treat once in a while. It is very important to exercise, I have read some reviews, where some have said they have done little or no exercise. My advice would be to incorporate exercise in as you go, after a while it will be like second nature and you will WANT to do it all the time! For those that just take the meds, it does help, but what are you going to do when you have to go off it? This is a lifestyle change, we all want to keep off the weight we lose ,right? I'm very proud of myself, and it feels good to know that all my hard work is starting to show. My friends and coworkers have complemented on my weight loss. Good Luck to all, will keep you posted.

column2: oly, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Here's the deal.  You know when you go out to eat and your stomach says to order the 90 ounce steak and 12 pound potatoe with our head of lettuce?  This gives you a literal moment to....pause.  It lets you THINK about what you are doing BEFORE diving in.  4 months = 44 pounds for me, with regular excercise and better diet.  If you have an Iphone - get "Lose It!" app - it's free.  That app, and this medcication has helped me to change my LIFESTYLE of excercise and eating.  I KNOW what I can eat everywhere I go - and eventually, it just becomes normal - you don't think about it. Get a competent health evaluation including an EKG before starting this med.  If you are a go by the Doc - do it.  EVERY meal - start with a half glass of water - make it a habit.  I now eat about 1300 calories, after my earned workout calories, a day and most days I cannot even eat that!

column2: Brighton,  Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I am a nurse and current user of adipex p. I wanted to comment after reading several posts here...adipex is prescribed for only three months for a reason - the risk for serious side effects (heart issues) increases with use. This is a controlled drug and any responsible doctor would monitor your BP and other medical conditions closely. I work with some Dr's who will simply not presribe this med because they are very concerned over possible effects on their patients. I wish for all who take it to really do your research, and not to take a rapid pulse, dizziness,and a noted higher BP lightly. Wishing you healthy results.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had lost about 65 pounds starting 4 yrs ago. I got down to 165 (starting at 230) i lost this weight by working out and eating right. Over the past yr I had managed to gain 25 of it back. I had never stopped working out but did begin to eat a little more (and im talking maybe 1300 calories a day). I was very frustrated with the fact that i couldnt keep the weight off even though i was eating healthy and working out. I have come to the conclusion that I basically have the body type where i have to starve to lose. I went to my Dr and told her about adipex (a friend from work had been succesful on this pill) she had never prescribed it before me. I started it July 9th 2010- i weighed 191 and had my one month appt on 8/4. I lost 11.2 pounds. This made me very happy. Today i am 178. My goal is to get back to my original 165. i just hope that this will help me keep the weight off. again, i know that, for me,  I have to take in about 1000 calories a day in order to lose, and most Drs would not suggest this, but taking in more literally made me gain. My side effects were dry mouth (which didnt bother me at all, i just drink lots of water), insomnia (not every night, but i have had some trouble sleeping) and a crash and burn feeling by about 4pm (where i feel super energized early in the day and by late afternoon i feel tired). none of these symptoms have been bad enough to make me want to stop taking the med. Overall, i am very pleased and do feel like these work. Definitley an appetite suppresant!

column2: Harlow, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've only been taking this medication for a short period of time and was told it would boost my overall weight loss/lifestyle change program and that the reason doctors are reluctant to prescribe it for short periods of time is to discourage patients relying too heavily on the medication and not committing to a change in eating habits and exercise. Anyway, I live in a large city in Alabama and have been told that many of the "Medi-Spas" who have Board Certified Physicians on staff are not quite as strict because they can help patients develop a weight loss plan and monitor them more closely than a regular GP can.  If I'm pleased with the results, I might explore one of these spas instead. I look forward to the one-on-one care for which these spas have become known. I've noticed several posts in which reviewers are worried about being "cut off" by their regular doctor. My advice is to check out one of these spas. I would just make sure they have a practicing physician on staff just to be safe.

I eat small portions three times a day and have become a way more active person. I have gone to not having any energy because of a hypoactive thyroid to doing the P90X work outs. Absolutley Amazing!

column2: stosh, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: have been on adipex for 4 months and have lost 30 lbs. It has helped my anxiety tons. I am in a better mood and I do not worry as much as I used to about little things. I have just noticed that my hair is getting thin. hopefully vitamins will help this.

column2: Tigger-n-Tx, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Been on generic for 5 yrs. Have lost 75 lbs. Causes jitters, constipation, & insomnia, but not bad enough to stop taking. Take Myralax as needed for constipation. Adipex very effective in beginning, but repeatedly hit a wall that I can't seem to overcome. Have weighed abt 180 with 10-lb variance for past 2 yrs. I'm female, 5'6", 34 yrs old.  I am a smoker & find that I smoke more while taking this med. Have stopped taking med periodically to let body "rest" & to reduce tolerance - every time I go off, I sleep for 14 hrs a day & still feel exhausted & then start eating like a pig - typically gain 15 lbs in first month.  I've never exceeded dosage, but I'm scared to know what will happen when my doc retires & I won't be able to get scrip anymore b/c most docs are just worried abt liability... Each time I stop, I wait for 1-3 mths before starting again & that helps to jump-start the weight loss again.  I've never suffered from HBP, & even after 5 yrs on this med, I still average 113/78.  Type II & HBP run in family, but have avoided so far. For the person asking abt the pharmacy, try a different one altogether (not just a different location of same company).  This drug helps to control impulsive eating - food doesn't seem as important & you think abt what you eat before you eat it instead of submitting to the impulse. Because of the "speed" effect, the motivation to exercise is a bit easier. Also, b/c of the cotton-mouth, you tend to drink more water which also helps you feel fuller faster. I feel like a "normal" adult while on this med b/c I actually have energy & a normal life - not just b/c of weight loss.  Before, I was too tired to make it thru the day w/o taking a nap & now I don't nap unless I'm taking a break from the med. I wish more docs would work with this med - I may have to start going across the border when my doc retires!

column2: TeamForce1, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My doctor prescribed me the generic form of Adipex to help me control my appetite and to lose weight. I was on the 37.5mg pill, but only took a half a pill a day for 2 months to get used to it. I lost 20 pounds in 2 months and now I take a whole pill a day. It controls my appetite and gives me more energy. Watch your caffine intake with this though. I have only experienced having a dry mouth with this, so I chew gum and drink alot of water. I do alot of walking as often as I can. You have to be willing to make lifestyle changes with this. Taking this while eating more healthier foods in conjunction with exercise will give you great results, but YOU have to eat right AND exercise to form lasting results. The reason some gain the weight back after going off the medicine is because they go back to their old habits again. That is why it is still important to eat right and exercise after stopping the medicine.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Two weeks after starting this medication I had lost 8 lbs. Two months in now, I have lost a total of 20 pounds and will continue for 2 more months. My body is responding well to it (along with light exercise and sensible diet). However, do not just stop taking it abruptly. I forgot to fill over a holiday weekend and spent the weekend in withdrawal in bed. Best to slowly stop taking it.

column2: DEB001, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on Apidex for one week now and have already lost 11 lbs. The first day I had tons of energy and could not sleep at night, I woke up at least 5-6 times during the night then finally gave up trying to sleep and got out of bed at 5:30 AM wide awake and was not tired all day. I have dry mouth all the time now so I drank a LOT of water. I don't feel hungry at all anymore and I was able to finally stop drinking soda too. I do feel jittery sometimes, minor headaches and clinching my teeth but the side effects come and go and could be because I forget to eat sometimes. I don't have as much energy as I had the first day but its still more than I am used to. I try to only eat healthy food now and stay under my calorie limit, I workout or walk at least 3 times a week. I usually have a bananna for lunch (which I have to force myself to eat bc I am not hungry) and then a regular (usually healthy)dinner. Over all I love the effectiveness, I have tried several other store bought pills and nothing as ever come close to working as well as Adipex has and it was cheaper than most of the other pills I have tried.

column2: BeantownChick617, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started to taking Adipex last Friday May 14, and I weighed in at 280. It seemed like no matter how hard I tried to excrise or how healthy I ate my weight would not move from being 280. My doctor prescibed adipex for me, and it has been working great... column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

I have gone down to 15 mg in the morning and 15 mg in the afernoon and it has been better, but the weight loss has slowed down.  Its going to take a while to get the extra 30 off.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
deputyjailer, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have taken Adipex several times in the past few years with great results.  I most recently began taking it at the end of January and as of March 30, I have lost around 30 lbs.  However, I believe that the Adipex is the cause of a seizure-like epidode that effects my head, neck, and face.  In the past few years, I have had spells where I get in a bad mood, followed by a sudden sharp pain in the right side of my neck and back of my head.  After the pain, my face then begins to draw toward the right side.  It looks as if I've had a stroke when this occurs.  I've been to several neurologists, including Vanderbilt University, with no medical explanations being found.  I went from July of last year til this past week without having an episode.  I've had 3 in the past 4 days.  After recounting every time I have took Adipex, it seems as if I only have these problems when I am taking the Adipex.  Therefore, I am going to stop taking them.  I love the weight loss, but nothing is worth the symptoms I experience when this occurs.  Sometimes it only lasts a few hours, other times it may last for a few days.  At some points, it makes me feel so ill that I have to go to bed, almost like I have the flu.  If anyone else has experinced symptoms like this, I would love to hear about them.

ladyj76, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been using adipex since October 2009. As of March 2010 I have lost 62 pounds. The most serious side effects I have noticed are dry mouth and constipation. The medication is still quite effective for me at the standard dose of 37.5mg twice a day. I am now over halfway to my goal weight. I have used this opportunity to completely change the way I eat. I knew when I started that I wanted to focus on eating more of a vegetarian diet. Adipex has helped me to do that. I have found healthier alternatives for the foods I used to crave and new foods that I would never have even considered trying prior to starting adipex. I think this change in my diet is very important to successfully maintaining my weightloss after I stop taking the medication.

column2: Maxomom, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This drug tends to work very well in most people as an appetite suppressant. However, you MUST eat regular small meals while attempting to lose weight even if you do not feel hungry. If the medication is not working for you, speak to your doctor. There are other options. It's effect will lessen over time and you will build up a tolerance to it. I lost 28 lbs in 6 months using this drug off and on. I have been off this drug for some time and will now take it again to lose my last 25 lbs. You must change your eating and exercise habits for life in order to lose and maintain a healthy weight. This drug makes me very thirsty and the extra water intake also helps with weight loss.

column2: Dedra, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was on Adipex-P from Dec. 07' until Feb. 07' and lost 30lbs--I had to make myself eat.  I have since had a baby and having trouble getting the weight off. I started taking it again on March 3, 2010--two days ago--I have endless energy, but my body is still trying to adapt.  After about two hours of non-stop cleaning, running around etc.....I get a little nauseas and run down feeling.  I lay down for about 30 mins and that seems to help.  Of course, I can't sleep.  It does cause severe insomnia the first week or so, but that should subside.  I take it at 6am, but still have trouble going to sleep until about 3-4am.  I have severe dry mouth, BUT, that is a good thing because I am craving water like crazy!!!  I hate water and drink Diet Coke constantly, so this has also helped flush my body out and is super good.  The only other thing that seems to bother me is my eyes get extremely dry and they ache.  If you really want to lose the weight, you just need to get past the first week or so of the negative side effects, then its easy street.  You made need to up your dose after a month or so, with you dr.'s permission of course.  Your body will get used to this and stop working as well.  Hope this helped someone!!  :-) Oh, I've already lost 4lbs in just two days.....im sure all the water consumption has something to do with that also.....

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: The medication works great at first. I lost about 30lbs in 4 months, most of it in the first month.  The meds do stop working at a certain point.  I became addicted to it and relied on the extra energy to get through my day.  It came to a point where I was abusing laxitives & diuretics just to lose enough weight for my doc to renew the prescription.  Once I stopped taking Adipex I became extremely tired, depressed, I had nightmares, cold sweats, etc.  I basically went through drug withdrawl.  If it isn't working for you try drinking more water and increase your fiber intake.  Good medication just be careful.

column9: I began taking Adipex on 12/03/09. It was prescribed by my doctor. I was seeking assistance in losing a little weight. The first day that I took the pill, I was up all day. I put out all of my Christmas decorations in one day. Sweet. I feel that I get a little more energy when I take this pill. Now as far as my eating habits, I have done what one would do to lose weight without the pill. I changed my habits-no fast food. I have also tempered my eating at real restaurants. I make sure that I am consuming fiber daily, as the pill can constipate you. I exercise at least 4 times a week, walking on the treadmill or doing a dvd. I drink a ton of water. I also monitor my blood pressure, as this pill can raise your bp.  My mouth is constantly dry. So far after 15 days, I have lost 6 lbs.  I am pleased. In order to prepare for taking this pill, I read as many reviews as possible. I researched it. The one thing that continually comes up is that you must exercise. I know this seems like a "given" but I thought I would reinforce was others have said.  I also found a meal plan for this drug on the internet-I hope this helps.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've been taking adipex for 4 days and i've lost 6 lbs. I don't think about sweets at all and it makes me able to make the right decisions about food. The only side effect i've noticed is that if i don't drink enough water i don't have as many bowel movements.

column2: mitchfam, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I listed my reason for using this medication as 'other' because my main complaint to my doctor was that my compulsion to eating was controlling my every waking moment.  I needed to lose about 40 lbs, but self control was out of the question.  From the first dose I felt the compulsion completely disappear.  I was able to make better decisions about what I ate; and NEVER was tempted to binge on every food I saw.  I also complained about anxiety, I have never been this calm.  After three weeks have lost about 12 lbs, which is just an added benefit; the most important factor is the absence of my compulsion that I have had for nearly 40 years.  My weight has fluctuated from 118 to 182; up and down with only temporary results having tried every bizarre diet out there.  I only hope the effects of this pill continue; and that the doctor continues to prescribe them for me.  He was reluctant to prescribe anything for the anxiety but said that this medication might help, I didn't even realize that it was for weight control (until I went to have the prescription filled and my insurance company stated that they cover no weight loss medication, however, the cost of the pill was only $28 for 30 days, I have spent far more than that on other useless meds).  Having tried every diet pill on the market I have never experienced anything like this one.  The first week I did experience high energy and jitters, during the second week this began to wear off, in the third week I have become more in tune with my bodies needs and try eating a little something every 2-3 hours, but again, I have to remind myself to eat.  Good luck to each and everyone suffering from this type of compulsion.

column2: Nurse, 35-44 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
