column2: GirlyGirl, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just started this medicine and am quite happy with it.  It really does curb your appetite and I see a little increase in energy.  The first day I was wired, but by mid-day I had calmed down and the second day it didn't have quite the same effect.  It does give you a dry mouth especially the first few hours after taking it and when you aren't drinking consistently.  When I'm hungry I can usually eat a little bit and then I almost start to feel a little nauseous after eating. Nothing too bad though, just enough to not be interested in food.  I sometimes compulsively eat and was afraid this wouldn't work for me because sometimes I eat even when I'm not hungry.  But so far that hasn't been a problem.  I just have not been thinking about food like I usually do.  I hope these effects stick around and don't wear off like they have for some.  I might try and take a few days off a week just to keep my body from getting too reliant on them.  Also as a side note.  This medicine isn't available without a prescription. TO my knowledge every place online that is selling it w/o one is not selling Adipex.  Look closely at the spelling: Phentermine vs. Phentramine.  Also, my doc said that brand name Adipex is preferred 2 out of 3 times, even though I know that they are supposed to be chemically identical. So get the brand instead of generic when you get your script filled. I will update a little later and let you know about my weight loss.  I just wanted to give advice to anyone thinking about taking it.  Like many others have said, you need to be ready to lose weight and commit to it.  The medicine won't stop you from eating food, or get you on a treadmill but it does give you a push in the right direction.  Good luck!

column2: me, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Visible results are not overnight, they are gradual, however, this product completely does away with cravings. The first few days, the thought of food almost made me sick, but now, I can eat a few bites of each item on my plate, and gladly push it away. The key to avoiding the "dizzy" side effect is to make sure to eat something. Even if just a banana or packet of instant oatmeal, power bar, the body needs fuel. The only minor side effect I experienced was for the first 4 days, it was hard to sleep. Now, not an issue.30 days in, and my clothes fit better! As this can cause constipation, I recommend getting some liquid soluble fiber and mixing it in morning coffee or juice.

column2: jennRN, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking this medication to help lose some weight because of a recent back injury. Since starting Adipex, I have lost over 40 lbs in less than 3 months. column9: I have had great success with this medication. It can make you jittery but subsides in time. I haven't snacked at all and when I eat my meals I don't overeat, and it is easier to eat healthier options when your not really hungry to begin with. I highly recommend this. I have had some jitters but when I break the pill in half, take one in the morning and then the other 8 hours later, it works best. Depends on the person. The doc recommended this until you know how you react to it. I have been successful in doing it this way. I started the med Sept 18th and have lost 16 lbs. as of Oct. 13th. Again, the only side effect I have experienced is jitters but it is very much worth it.

column2: LillyRo, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking Adipex weighting 168 pounds and Im only 52!  After taking in for 3 months I lost 30 pounds. This worked for me because ones I stopped taking them I did not gain any of the weight back.  My doctor advised me to take them for 3 months straight and then give my body some rest from the pill for 1-2 months and then begin the treatment again.Im currently back on the pill to loose the remaining weight!  I truly recommend Adipex as long as its consumed with control.  One of my girlfriends has become addictive to it she has been taking them for 3 years now and that is highly dangerous.

column2: Kristen, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking adipex for 2 1/2 weeks and have lost 8 pounds.  That may not sound like a lot to mst of you- but it used o take me 2-3 months to lose 8 pounds!  I'm starting to incorporate exercise into my plan.  I had foot surgery in December and am still slowly healing, so my cardio is restricted.  I'm very happy right now with my rate of lose. column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking this med in july. I don't take it on a regular basis. I've lost 18 lbs. I'm satisfied. I still have about 60 lbs to go. I'm giving myself til next summer. I believe it will happen

column2: nurseonthepill, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Hi my name is Chantelle, I took Adipex for 8 weeks... the first 3 weeks i lost 16lbs. i was soo energized.. my husband would come home to a spotless house and dinner on the table(we had 4 boys 3,5,9,&10) so you understand this never happened!lol!! After that i didnt lose a pound, i kept taking it hoping i would lose more.Then I went to my gyno who did some blood work, i wasnt losing because i developed "HYPOTHYROIDISM" yes people this drug stopped my thyroid from working properly, its been 2 years since ive taken it... ive put on another 30lbs and i now weigh 200lbs.. I quess im want to say be careful just because it works doesnt mean itll make you perfect there are long term effects.Plus when you lose weight fast youll have saggy skin.

column2: RJC79, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Wow, I have never, let me repeat, NEVER! had any type of will power. When the doctor was giving me the life style and habit change chat and was thinking, wow this is going to be hard. I started taking the pill when I woke up and had 1 cup of Special K cereal with a half cup milk and that was it. I do get the "jitters" that everyone was reporting but that is not from the pill it is from a low calorie diet. During the next 8-9 hours I have as much water as it takes to satisfy the dry mouth and a Wal-Mart branded Granola bar (90 calories) and no lunch. At home I eat a moderate dinner, mostly grilled meat and any side we choose to go with it. I found with this pill the hunger pains are gone 95% of the time. How wonderful! I have done no real exercise, just yard work. I've been on this pill for 7 weeks and have lost 40lbs. Holy crap is this that a great number. Still want to lose 40-50lbs more. Wish me luck! All in all if you have read this whole raving, this pill is worth it. Good luck!

column2: mealor, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
Blessed, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: GREAT RESULTS- BUT BE CAREFUL! DON'T DRINKHello. I just wanted to share my story with you all. I took this drug about two years ago. My starting weight was 180 and by the end of 3 months I weighed 139. A total of 41 lbs in 3 months.. holy cow! I loved it. At this time in my life I was a college student and drank alot. I knew that the dr's had warned me about drinking while taking this medication.. but I didn't listen. After taking this for awhile.. and drinking alot, the next night would be horrible. I would wake up in the middle of the night and my whole body would be numb, I couldnt speak to tell anyone what was wrong, I couldnt walk to get help,I would have a cold sweat, and I had a very very fast heart rate. When this started happeneing I started having panic attacks during the day. And if anyone knows what a panic attack feels like... its horrible. Finally I hit rock bottom.. one night I have a seizure/tremors. Finally looked up the side effects and decided to stop the med. I COULD HAVE DIED BC OF MY STUPID DECISION!!!Please please take mine and the dr's advice when taking this med!Now a year later.. Sober! Went back to the dr because I wanted to try it again. Got it 2 days ago and already lost 6 lbs. I don't exercise, with the exception of being on my feet all day at a hospital. I do eat very healthy. I incorporate weight watchers  into my routine.Anyways, this drug is great for losing weight. But please please take my advice and DO NOT DRINK. No one would want those side effects.Peace and Love to All!!!

column2: Kristen, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started on the generic adipex on 9/9/09 and last weighed in on 9/20.  In a week and a half, I lost 5.5 pounds.  I started on the full pill and then cut it back to a half and still do not feel hungry.  On the full pill, I could go all day without eating.  With only half of the pill, I occasionally feel slight hunger.  The only side effect that I have is extreme thirst.  My throat gets so dehydrated that I constantly feel like I have a hair in the back of my throat, and no amount of drinking seems to cure it.  It's why I switched to half a pill.  So far, I am very pleased with my progress.  It would take me two months to lose what I lost in a week and a half!  Now, I look forward to weighing in Sunday morning.  I'll post my resluts then.

column2: radian, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I began this medication on June 2, 2009. I am ending my 3 month cycle with a total weight loss of just under 20lbs. That's what I needed; it was a plateau. I have always known "what to do" but overwhelming urges to eat (I LOVE FOODS!) and snack combined with an erratic schedule, early change of life issues and such led to my adding over 30lbs in a short time. This med cleared my brain (as antidepressants helped depressed people get their tools in order) so I could utilize my dietary and exercise to the fullest. I am so happy to have has this chance.

column2: gayle, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started on Adipex on July 5, 2009. I weighed in at 279. Now, on August 21, 2009 I am at 267.5. Not bad, but I need to exercise more. I have trouble with cravings in the late evening. column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: subsailorslady29, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just started taking the generic version of Adipex 37.5 mg on 08/15/09 to help me continue the losing weight. Insurance doesn't cover it, but it wasn't expensive. I only paid $21.95 for it from my regular pharmacy. I have never really had any trouble maintaining my weight or losing but, after I got really sick in Sept of 2008 and was in ICU for a week and was given all kinds of Steroids and pumped full of fluids and gained 40lbs I was unable to take that extra weight off. I have had some adverse health side effect because of it such as High Blood Pressure, Edema, and countless others. In the last two months I have lost 20lbs on my own and my doctor asked me if I would like something to help control my appetite. He prescribed the Adipex and said I can only take it for three months because after that it would no longer be effective and that I could become pyschologically dependent on this medication. I take it once a day after breakfast and so far haven't really had any side effects other than feeling jittery, and lots of nausea. I take Chloral Hydrate at bedtime for insomina that I have had for years, so I would be unable to tell if the medication is causing more insominia or not. I started out 2 months ago at 220, currently I am at 200. My goal over the next three months is to reach my ideal body weight of 135-145. Would like to really be at 125lbs. I am 5'7" with an average body frame. I eat fairly healthy and get exercise regularly. I have always been very self-conscience about my weight and I am hoping that with a little extra boost from this medication I can obtain what has seemed so far out of reach for so long. I am not expecting miracles, no pill can provide that, but I do hope this helps shove me in the right direction. Good luck to all of you that are on this medication. Will update y'all on my progress in one month and let y'all know how I am doing. I am glad that my doctor suggested this medication. Any advice please e-mail me at lisakay_0219@yahoo.com

column2: Skeetle, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started taking prescription Adipex 3 days ago. I absolutely LOVE this medicine. Ive tried everything to lose weight and this seems to be working. Like most, I have serious dry mouth and cant get enough water; but I get dehydrated easily (Ive even had to be hospitilized for severe dehydration before) so I consider the increase in water a great benefit. I know it sounds bad but I am not hungry at all! I feel like I can concentrate better and am able to get a lot done. I think this is because I am no longer worried or stressed out because of my weight. It seems like it has worked wonders for mostly everyone and Im excited to see the results that lie ahead! Im wondering if the people who havent had success are people who didnt get a prescription from their doctor. When I told my doctor that I tried it before after buying it online, he said "You cant get this online, what youre getting is basically a placebo." Which is completely true. In comparing the one I bought online with the one from an actual doctor, the pills looked TOTALLY different. I can feel the prescription strength Adipex working and felt it from the first day.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: FIrst off - this is not a magic pill, if you are not willing to count your calories and exercise more you won't get teh results you want. I've been on this pill for 6 weeks, I just got back from my doctor's appt and I have lost a total of 18 pounds since starting. The drug helps curb your cravings and does give you extra energy to become more active. I felt a little off the first few days, mainly a kind of dissiness and restlessness, but it went away after 48 hours. Other than that no other side effects. My blood pressure has gone down and I know exercise about 3 hours a week.I can't imagine anyone taking this pill without their doctor's supervision. There are very real side effects and by no means should it be taken recreationally.That said, I have a lot more work to do and more weight to lose. This pill just makes getting through the day easier.

column2: blessedmomof3, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started taking adipex on 7/22/09, I have lost about 5 lbs with less then moderate exercise. The only side effects I have really had is the dry mouth, which is wonderful becuase all I want to do now is drink water and this is coming from someone who barely drank water.  THe first 2-3 days I had the jitters (could be due to the cup of coffee)  had one dizzy spell, I guess becuase I got up too fast and the fourth day I had a killer headache all day. (not sure if the meds were an attribute)  I haven't had the burst of energy as I have read in others reviews but I did wake up once in the middle of the night unable to go back to sleep for several hours. But over the last few days I have had no side effects so in my opinion this medication is wonderful. I was apprehensive at first to take it becuase of the side effects, but the good out weighed the bad and what medicine is available out here without the possibility of side effects, so here I am and looking forward to the next 3 weeks to see how much more I can loose.  i am excited b/c I have been struggling to get past the plateau which I have now I just need to shake of like 20 more lbs :)

column2: autumnsky11, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I began using Phentermine for a short duration of time, it worked to my satisfaction with a diet change of no carbs, and excercise for the duration that I will be on the meds till I reach my desired goal, and then collaborate with a nutritionist to change my eating habits and live a healthier life. My initial doc. retired and I have found another, however, this time I will be using Adipex. I read some of the reviews and noted that some lost 5-8 pounds without excercise and some lost 3 in the first week and none after.  It is quite important that you begin a regimen of excercises with your diet and overcall change of eating habits if you want this to work properly. Secondly, someone inquired about being taken off the meds after 6 months; for one month. In my own experience, that occurs when the doctor feels you are close to your goal weight or it is just time to get you off for one reason or another. For myself, and 3 other family members, it was done to determine our eating habits at that point and to see if we can sustain our weight without gaining or continue to lose without the dependentcy of Adipex or Phentermine. Also to see how one feels off the meds. While under this substance I strongly suggest you do not only take the meds and cut down on foods, sweets, but condition yourselves and educate yourselves on eating healthier,  working out, and just having a change of lifestyle for those that are obese or have problems remaining at their goal weight. You work too hard to gain it all back after you are done. Whether you are taking Adipex or Phetemine - this med is only taken for a period of time and cannot be taken for long durations at a time. For instance you reached your goal in 6 months, gain a good amount in a month because you returned to old habits, and then decide you want to get back on the meds. Not recommended nor healthy - I speak of my own experiences, my own research, and my collaboration with my doctors - on the why, if's, buts and so on. Goodluck

column2: cuba, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I've taking Adipex on and off for a couple of years. I keep a spare stash for those monthly days or parties. :) The first round I lost 17lbs in 2 weeks, a total of 63lbs. From size 12 to a 4/6-lowest I've been since i was a teenager! I started working out 2-3 days and eventually became addicted to it doing it 6 days, 1-1.5 hr tops. Loved the changes my body was making. The trick is drinks lots of water and excerise. Water activates the pill ingrediant and allows you to flush out your system. First few days I barely eat until my body adjusts. For those of you that see no weight loss after 4 weeks...the 1st month you lose the most in lbs, 2nd month less lbs but more inches, 3rd month you're body is adjusted and retaught to eat healthier & lbs/inches are slower pace. Not sure if any of you noticed but your body doesn't enjoy fatty or sugary foods anymore. It's a good weight loss pill and it teaches you to eat healthy. As for those asking about constipation, I asked my dr and his response was "if you're not eating, what do you expect to let out"? I suppose it makes sense. Well, wish everyone luck and lots of lbs lost.

column2: Tatiana, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: To Zeeva: I'm older also, had weight gain of 35 lbs after hysterectomy. Tried dieting, exercising; nothing worked for me until Adipex. In 45 days I've lost 31 lbs. Because it's an amazing hunger suppressant, Ihave plenty of time to make healthy food choices. I've kept a food journal, documenting my meals, calories and weight on a daily basis. Doing this has given me the opportunity to see what works and what does not. I also report how I'm feeling physically because of the side effects.  I tend to have palpitations, however when I eat properly and don't restrict calories too much it doesn't occur.  After 2 1/2 wks. I plateaued. Having everything written down gave me the opportunity to see what worked and what did not. For anyone who is not losing weight as quickly as they would like, you may want to try it. I'm planning my menus in the am and making weekly goals.... Only 5 lbs away from my target weight and that's it for me.  The big clothes are already out of the closet.  I won't ever let the weight creep up again!  Good Luck to Everyone!!  From all the posts I read it sounds like you're all doing so great!  p.s. Zeeva - your medication may be partially counteracting the effect of the pill. I noticed that it happened to me as well. We just have to try a little harder:)  I just love getting old:)

column2: wanna be slim diva, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: Bloom0915, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i have been taking the generic of adipex for 1 month 2 weeks and 3 days. i feel great. i don't exercise everyday, but a couple times a week, and i just started doing that. i lost 12 lbs. on just the pill alone, but i needed to start doing something to help tone up. i exercise for 30 min. a couple times a week. i walk and run for about 15 min. or so on my treadmill and some cardio. i noticed after i started taking the medicine that i was eating less and throwing away alot more food. so i changed my plate size to a "little" plate. and that really helps, i don't put more than what i can eat on the plate, and if i'm still feeling hungry, i wait for a couple minutes, and if i still feel that way, i will get a little more to eat and that usually helps. i try to have small snacks through out the day so that doesn't happen, but i'm not always able to. i recomend this pill for anyone who is overweight and looking for a solution. i've told just about everyone i know about adipex.

column2: zee249, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: this is my first week on the generic of 30mg phentermine and I have lost 4.5lbs. I did not feel hungry in the 1st 5 days but lately, i constantly feel hungry. I notice that my fasting blood sugar and sugar 2 hours after my meal are quite high. my highly effective carb blocker does not seem to be working. pls let me know if you are diabetic and you have a similar problem my email is firstgreatcommission@yahoo.com on the subject section, reference phentermine. thanks.

column2: jane1958, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

I have always had dry mouth because of other meds but I have noticed an increase.  I have also noticed a problem with my sleep - I sleep about 2 hrs then wake up..2hrs more.. wake up.  I am a little jittery and have a headache behind my eyes that I hope goes away soon.  Even with these problems I feel they are minor compared to being this overweight.  I do have more energy and feel better overall. I have lost about 3lbs since I started but it hasn't been a week yet.  So far so good.. i'll update

Any words of encouragement would be appreciated.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started the generica adipex-P in January and had wonderful results. I have lost 20 lbs. Started at 198 and am down to 178.  I was wearing size 16, now wearing 12, looking to be a size 8 in few months.  I found new energy and since I have always exercised, that was never a problem, but when the weight comes off, you can exercise more and longer.  I started weight training 3 times a week along with regular cardio 6 days a week.  I have extremely toned arms and legs now, and my belly is the main concern.  I mostly watch my diet and portion control, but I don't deprive myself of any food. I have hit the plateau like everyone is talking about, so I quit taking the pills for a week and have started them up again, and seems to work for me so far.  I have maintained my weight loss so far and looking to lose at least another 10 lbs.  My Doc said I could take the pills for six months, I am unsure whether I will need them that long.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: usmc1195, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started this medication five weeks ago.  In the first ten days, I lost a pound a day.  At my recheck a week ago, I'd lost a total of 11 pounds for the month.  My PA gave recommendations for the plateau that everyone seems to be experiencing:  she said to watch the sodium intact (the salt is making us retain the vast amounts of water we're drinking to counteract the dry-mouth), fluctuate the calorie intake once a week, and do one completely abnormal physical activity per week.  So I'm an avid horseback rider.  In stead of doing that one day, I'm going to play racquetball until I'm drenched in sweat and sore.  It's supposed to shock the body.As far as reactions:  dry mouth (of course), diarrhea, headaches, two nights of insomnia and my period came a week early.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had posted something back in January when I began this medication. I am 31yrs old and have never been even a little overweight even after having both of my children. Last March I had a total hysterectomy and within 8mths had gained about 40pounds. I was very nervous about taking this drug. I had been very depressed and fatigued and after talking with my doctor a couple of times we decided to give this a shot. I have always been a runner so we agreed together that before I started I would lose just 3-5 pounds on my own then give it a shot. I started running again back in December and went back to the doctor and I had lost 3 pounds so we gave it a  shot and WOW I had the energy I needed to get back to the way I used to feel. I am now off the medication and still running 5 miles a day and also still watch what I eat. This is NOT a magic pill because if so we all would be thin! I am a nurse and feel that sometimes people just need that little bit of help. If anyone is reading this and is overweight and feeling depressed, you can so totally lose your weight. It is not easy but if you truly put your whole heart and mind to it YOU WILL DO IT!!! I feel so much better and back to my normal me now. Well I wish everyone luck on getting yourself on a new lifestyle changing path! Tracie

column2: adel, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: morning star, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have tried everything to lose weight.  I started taking Adipex in Dec. '08 and as of Mar. '09, I am down 28 pounds.  I feel great and don't even feel hungry.  I haven't change much about my diet other than eating less of it!  I have 85 pounds to go and now, I can truly say that I believe I can do it!  I'll report back in 6 months!  Try it - you will NOT regret it!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I read over 100 reviews before taking this drug and was scared I'd be one of those people that has a terrible reaction to it. But I wasn't. Adipex is very helpful. It has given me energy and reduced my appetite. I haven't had insomnia. It has given me the dry mouth everyone talks about. All the water I've been drinking as a result has improved my skin. It's not a magic pill. (If there were a magic weight loss pill, everyone would be skinny.) If I weren't already very motivated and in tune with my body's hunger cues, it would be pretty easy to ignore the effects of the drug and eat whatever I wanted or "because it's time to eat." Exercise and paying attention to your body's hunger cues are key. I lost 25 lbs last summer and got stuck at around 170 and stayed there for 5 months despite reducing my calories to 1300 and exercising 5 days a week (with intense cardio, not just walking). I've been on Adipex for 4 days and have lost 4 lbs. I'll update at the end of my two month supply. My target weight is 130.

column2: annanfussell2, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: ok so if the adipex works and but i feel im not really getting the results i want what else is there to do? like i said im on my second bottle but dont really feel like inches are coming off.weight has. but not many inches that i can tell. went down a few pants sizes but that was all in the butt.

column2: m1davis, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

I think there is an epidemic of it going around at work now!

column2: ruthr63, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

I lost 40 lbs and getting to start round two with the generic. Is it still true that the dr. can only give it to you for 3 months at a time? I need to loose about 75 lbs. before wedding.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started this pill on 3/3/09, and I have lost 9 lbs so far. I have awesome energy, not much of an appetite, and overall I feel better. For the previous reviewer, 2 weeks into it my chest hurt and my throat felt like it was going to close up. I hated the feeling but I also seen a pattern with it. I started with taking half a pill 2x a day and then switched to a full pill once a day. As soon as those symptoms came on, I went back to the half a pill 2x a day. I feel better. However, I take the pills close together because if I take the 2nd one too late, I can't sleep. My first one I take at 7AM and then the 2nd one I take at 11:30AM so I'm ready for lunch at noon. I'm proud for the little bit of weight I've lost but I'm working my butt off to lose lots more. My goal is 20lbs and 1 size by the end of April. I think I can do it. Good luck to everyone.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a diabetic with high blood pressure that weighed 195 lbs. My dr told me that I needed to lose about 30 lbs and that would help my high blood pressure and my diabetes. I tried watching what I ate, exercised and drank alot of water but obly ended up losing 2 lbs in 2 months. I am on a 1200 calorie diet due to my diabetes. My dr put me on adipex 37.5 (generic one) on Jan. 4 I took a half in the morning at 6am and then the other half at 9:30 am. I did not have a appetite all day and I had tons of energy which I really liked and did not have any problems sleeping at night. By the end of my first week, I lost 10 lbs, man was i excited and shocked, i did not expect to lose that much. I continued taking it that whole month of Jan and when I went back to the dr in Feb I weighted in at 169, I lost 26lbs in one month and I didnt even exercised. I was so pleased, my blood pressure was normal and my sugar had been good, which also pleased my dr. I continued taking it the month of Feb b/c I still needed to lose a few more pounds. By the next month I weighted in at 150. I lost another 19lbs and went from a size 18 to a size 12. I lost 45 lbs in two months and I was surprised that now that I dont take it I am still losing 1 or 2 lbs in a week and I am not gaining the weight back. I fell much better about myself and my health has approved alot. I would recommend adipex to anyone who wants to lose weight.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 25yrs old and at my last dr. apt on feb 17, I weighed in at 258 lbs. I cried. I have never been that heavy my entire life. Lately I have tried taking a whole pill in the morning because I was having a hard time sleeping at night, I sleep better but I also feel drained by 7pm. I like doing half a pill 2x a day. column2: jth504, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Not really sure if it is fair to rate my experience with this new medication already, since I only began taking it today. I had gastric bypass surgery in May of 2004 and lost from 303 down to 163.  I have slowly gained back up to 227 pounds, and my health is worse than ever. I'm anemic, have hypothyroidism, take topamax for migraines and frequent headaches, Xanax for stress management, Provigil so that I don't fall asleep at the wheel again, and now I am starting this new medicine. My dosage is 37.5 (the generic form), and my insurance doesn't pay for it (of course!!!). They'll pay for you to have heart surgery and all kinds of other surgeries due to waiting too long to take care of your health, but being PROACTIVE--NO, BCBS of Alabama says no, thanks! Doesn't make sense, does it? Like with birth control--they won't pay for birth control, but they don't mind paying for my cousin to have her 4th out-of-wedlock, who-knows-who-the-father-is, child, which will cost the health insurance company a fortune, and will be living off of our tax dollars because of all the programs out there for the people that live in "extreme poverty". ( I say keep your legs closed, and the nation wouldn't have so many issues to deal with.)Back to the original subject-- My doctor also started me on a new medicine today that my night-shift nurse friend told me they give their patients at night to help them sleep. I took it for the first time this morning along with my Adipex---20 minutes later, I was bumping into walls and feeling like I had had a few drinks. 2 hours later, I turned into a zombie, never actually fell asleep, (b/c my children were with me) but I was extremely tired! I now know to take it at night. I can't wait to take my Adipex tomorrow and see how it makes me feel. I had absolutely NO appetite today. I ate 1 chicken sandwich for lunch and a few bites of boiled broccoli for dinner. I'm not "full", I just don't feel "the need" to eat/snack. It's a good feeling. Wish me luck!!

column2: nurseling, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Well, after gaining 40 lbs after nursing school and working nights..I finally broke down to my doctor. I had tried the low carb thing but it just seemed to make me cranky and the 18 lbs I lost bounced right back with an additional 10 lbs to boot. The calorie counting was hard and I still felt deprived the majority of the time. I started Adipex yesterday and was very surprised at how fast it takes effect. The side effects were a little scary. I have had panic attacks before and it feels almost the same. The heart pounding, dizziness, tingling, dry mouth but after a few hours the side effects decrease. I do believe I will need to lower my dose and take one half per day. It has greatly reduced my cravings and snacking binges. I have much more energy and feel like this will do well for me. Do beware the side effects and the dose.  I definitely recommend taking half the dose to begin with. Will post results in a month :-)

column2: shj3, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was unable to get my weight done after my 3rd child. After having her a had post pardum depression and was put on Paxil, A year later I had discovered I had gained over 20lbs cause of the paxil. So when personal trainers still could not get the weight off I was put on this. I started on New Year's day and went 3 days ago for my first weigh in..I lost 18lbs!!! and somewhere during the month I stopped with the exercise(no matter what couldn't find the time) But for me this is great, I had tried any and every diet pill on the shelves and nothing worked as well and as long as this!!I do still have 52lbs more to go but have no doubt what so ever that I'll have any problems while taking Adipex.Dry mouth is the only side effect besides a little constipation in the beginning which I now take  Fiber Choice for and it helped!!!Can't wait to see how much I lose next Month......keep ya informed!!

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
priiss, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have gradually gained weight since my 4th child.  With my 5th I was told I had GD, I was sent to a nutrionist.  I lost 6 pds in one week on the diet they told me to follow.  It was and is not hard to follow watch your carbs.  Breakfast 45 carbs (anything you like as long as it's 45 and under, snack 30 carbs a slice of bread has 15 carbs, a small fry from McD's 30 carbs, moving on lunch 45 carbs, snack 30 carbs, dinner 45 carbs--Try to stay AWAY from red meats and fried foods of course.  But you may eat small portions of red meat if  necassary.  Okay back to dinner chicken, fish, pork, (baked, grilled)Half of a  Baked Potatoe with one tsp of (try Promise butter) salt and pepper...corn is the fattiest veggie there is so when eating corn have a cup and no other veggie, with broccoli, carrots, cauliflower, green beans etc.. you may have a cup of each.  I drink tons of water or substitute with generic brand of crystal light yummmmm.. snacks I eat fresh peach half with a cup of fat free cottage cheese, Kiwi on a wrap with fat free cream cheese and fat free strawberry jam another goody.  Just some Ideas to follow if you need more let me know... after I had my baby I stopped when I knew it was so healthy HUGE mistake!  I know am trying adipex along with my healthy diet, and excersise--Tae-bo, Tredmill, ab lounger...about 30-45 mins a day..I feel so energetic and WOW I can get things done without feeling Blahhhhh...Although I do feel hungry still I am now on my diet and it keeps you full.  So good luck to all!

column2: Jilly Jill, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Hey there!  I am a 29yr old single mom and full-time college student. On New Years Day, I stepped on the scale and almost threw the dang thing out the window!!!  It said 200 lbs. I had gained almost 40lbs in 5 months.   :o( well...I have been taking Phentermine 37.5MG (Generic for Adipex-P 37.5mg) for 4 days now. >I have lost 5 lbs<  I am just getting back into the exercise thing again (YUCK)...making time is a freakin challenge but so is buttoning my pants lately - therefore... I CHOOSE to LOSE! My goal is to reach 150 lbs.  I used to be on the name brand version (Adipex-p) about 1 1/2 yrs ago and I lost a ton of weight.  I got down to around 155 and was EXTREMELY happy.  HOWEVER, after I stopped taking the pills, I slowly gained the weight back.  I did get REALLY sick and depressed, but my old doc didn't wean me off of it properly. It was MY FAULT for gaining the weight back due to poor eating habits!  I got really comfortable in my relationship and apparently just started shoving food in my face!  LOL!  Anywho, I am excited to lose weight again and FOLLOW THROUGH with a life style change this time. Sorry this is so long but I BLAME THE ADIPEX (Euphoria)...j/k.  My side effects have been pretty extreme.  I can't sleep at all, I don't want to eat (whoo-hoo), My mouth feels like a desert, and my moods are up and down.  My hands are so shaky that I'm writing like a doctor with arthritis! This happened last time and the effects subsided after about a week.  EVERY medication has side effects and losing weight is worth it to me!!  Gum helps with the dry mouth...so does Crystal Light (energy) YUM!Just wanted to share my (incredibly long) story and put in my 2cents.  I wish you all GREAT success with your weight loss journey and appreciate all the info my fellow "adipex-ers" have shared!  ~Many Blessings~ *here is a link to a website I found very informative about Adipex...just in case you are interested*  http://www.rxlist.com/adipex-p-

column2: Nikki Please, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on this pill for 29 days and am going on my first check up tomorrow... According to my scale I have lost 14lbs during the 29 days... I am continuing my same workout schedule that I had before I started taking the pills... Roller derby practice 3 times a week for 1-2 wach time... Since I have lost the 14lbs I have alerady notice my skating speed increase which I believe is helping me to burn even more calories then I was before. I also have to force myself to eat. I eat 1200 calories on the days I dont have practice and 1600 on the days that I practice... You need to make sure that you don't starve yourself when you take these pills other wise you are setting yourself up for failure since your metabolism is going to be out of whack... Also it is important to make sure you are forming healthy habits while you have the extra assistance...

column2: Michigan Girl, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: austinbe12, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I'm 20 yrs. old, 5'10" and started off at 195 when I got on Adipex on December 30, 2008. I immediately lost 10 pounds in a week, then another 2. I haven't been hungry at all, and I have exercised everyday the past month, I get on a stationary bike for 30 minutes with a 6 resistance then a 'running machine' for 30 min. I got on the scale today and have GAINED 2 pounds! My jeans are actually getting tighter around my ass and thighs...I don't know what I'm doing wrong here..My face isn't near as puffy, but I'm literally freaking out over this! I walk 2 miles to my college campus and back everyday on top of the gym workouts. I don't understand why my ass and thighs are so swollen and my pants are tighter, when my 6 pack is already showing again and when I suck in, my ribcage is poking through.I've lost 50 lbs in the past, but stopped at 170 (from 220) and I have fluctuated between 170-190 the past 2 years. column2: ladyt, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: First let me say I started in oct 2004 at 283lbs. WITHOUT any meds with JUST diet and exercise and going throug a divorce I lost 110lbs reaching 174lbs in 10 months. I am a 5ft 8in female so this was a good weight and got to keep my "Betty Boop figure. I kept the weight off for about three years. In  the last year I put on 30lbs going to 207 I have been on adipex on and off for about6 weeks. The first 2 weeks I lost 15 lbs with diet and exersice going to 189lbs and platued i had to stop for a week because i had major constipation.  I gained 2 lbs back (prob in poop) When I started back with also eating 4 prunes nightly, i have lost another 4lbs. I think the week break helped to get the weight loss started again.My doctor only allows 12 weeks on this med every 6 months so my goal is more than half way done. i do take 1/2 twice daily because it did make me jittery.  I am happy with this.  I plan to wean down the last 2 week under my dr advice to get my body used to being without it and to prevent gaining the weight back. i wiil say it is  a lifestyle change to lose and keep it off from previous experience.  I became comfortable in a new relationship and cooking more and going out ot eat and not working out AT ALL. I now work out 5 days a week 30 miutes a day and eat well even before taking the adipex.  It was a last resort.  I tried for 6 months on my own and couldnt lose a pound.  This has jumpstarted my metabolism again. Im very happy with it so far.

column2: Mudslick, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

I am almost 6' tall and weight 197.  I am hoping to drop 40 pounds to get to my ideal weight according to my BMI.  I exercise regularly, so that has never been an inhibitor of not losing weight, it truly is the cravings for the sweet stuff and the carbs that I love.  In addition to this treatment, I am exercising, planning a good diet balanced with proteins, fruits and vegetables at every meal and healthy snacks.  I also purchased online a cd from a hypnosis therapist who claims that you can lose the weight like that by training your sub-conscious mind to think healthier and eat healthier.  So far, I really thought it was working, but I think putting this all together will/should help.  I will post again when I start to see results of endeavors..

IF IM NOT @ WORK I CAN GO ALL DAY W/O EATING & WHEN I START TO FEEL SICK I EAT A PUDDING OR SOMETHING. I TOTALLY AM NOT A BIG EATER.  I WEIGHED 200 LBS ON 10/03/08. I HAVE BEEN MONITORING MY BLOOD PRESSURE & I HAVE ALWAYS BEEN LOW, BUT IT HAS BEEN HIGH SINCE STARTING IT. MY HEART RACES & MY RESTING HEART RATE IS LIKE 120 BPM(WHICH OVER TIME CAN'T BE HEALTHY) I ALSO COULD NOT SLEEP FOR THE FIRST 2 WEEKS....I DO TAKE THE MED @ 6A WHEN I GET UP.I TAKE IT 1 TIME A DAY. column2: smartblonde_9, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 20 yrs old and weighed my all-time high of 201 lbs when I started Adipex a little over 4 months ago. My last weigh in was 1 month ago and I had lost 30 lbs but I measure success by inches rather than pounds. I have lost 3 inches in my waist and 2.5 inches in my hips. I work out as often as I can in between classes and other activities. The side effects have been very mild, mostly dry mouth and a some restless nights, but I already had trouble sleeping thru the night before I started Adipex. I love how much I dont crave the foods that were so hard to resist before I started taking it. I live off of campus cafeteria food so it is hard to eat healthy but with the extra energy my will power and desire to reach my goal make it so easy to avoid the really unhealthy things. I do treat myself now and then to prevent any cravings from getting too overbearing though. And I drink about 80 oz of water a day. I can go without thinking about food for a whole day, but you have to make sure you eat at least 2 well-balanced meals a day or your energy level will go down. My next weigh in is this weekend, I hope it goes well!!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: in january of 2007 i weighted 170lbs, i decided to do something about. i joined a women's gym and started working out everyday in 2 months time i had only lost 3lbs i stopped going to the gym and reached my all time high of 180lbs. i am only 5'3" so it looked like i was whale.everyone would tell me you dont look that big you hold the weight good. so in september of 2007 i decided to see a weight dr because i had heard about adipex-p and how good it works. in the first month i lost 10 lbs. i was a little cautious about taking it but it gave me energy to lose the weight. now it's october 2008 and i weight 140lbs. i went from a size 16 to a size 10. i lost exactly 40lbs. i work out at least 5 times a week and eat right i have completly stopped drinking sodas. crystal lite and water have become my best friends. i love veggies more than ever. i have stopped taking the pill and i am just maintaining. i want to at least lose 10 more lbs and i will be done. i would recommend this to anyone who has tried to lose the weight and could not.

column2: jus4me, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was a little overweight in my early years but it was easy for me to lose once I decided to.  However, as I grew older, I noticed I was adding pounds on each year...middle age spread, depression and then menopause.  I was not able to lose any noticeable weight until trying Adipex-P.  I had tried other appetite suppressants such as Tenuate, Fastin, Pondimin and Redux in years past but either they did not help with controlling my appetite and/or I had "jitters", restlessness and insomnia.  Side effects were not worth it nor could I function effectively at work.  Several years had gone by...often thought I would like to lose weight but...no self motivation.  I then heard about Adipex-P.  I have lost about 20 lbs over the past nine months...but I'm sure I could have lost more if I had put more effort in it.  But now that "I" can tell that I have lost some weight, I do desire to try even harder.  With Adipex-P, I do not have restlessness, heart racing, jitters, insomnia, etc.  For me, Adipex-P increases "my" willpower not to have this or that but also makes me feel like I did twenty or more years ago....I make not look younger but I feel younger and that is a good feeling.

column2: wannabehealthy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been taking this med for almost 8 weeks. I went from 170# to today's weight at 152#. The appetite suppression and diminishedideas of thinking about food definitely does not work as well as it used to. The literature states that the effects will start to wear off after prolonged use. I also noticed that I have alot of aches and pains, mostly when I walk up a flight of stairs, does thi happen to anyone else? Overall I think this is the best thing that I have ever dsone for myself, I have tried many diets and failed, but this is by far the best. I will be getting a refill soon along with the weigh-in and bp check. Although I feel that I'm doing great looking at some of the weight losses mentioned here I feel as the I could be doing better. Anyone else feel that way or is it just me with weight loss envy? I will check in again to let you know more about the weight loss saga. Bye for now.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Adipex for 1 month. So far,with dieting and regular weight/cardio exercise, I have lost 12 lbs. This doesn't really seem like much compared to some of the other people on this site. I lost the greatest amount of weight (8lbs) the first week. 2nd week fluctuated back and forth 1-2 lbs with a total weekly loss of 2 lbs. 3rd week fluctuated 1-2 lbs with a total loss of 1 lb. This week ended with another 1 lb. weight loss. Although I didn't have a lot of weight to initially lose it is still slightly discouraging that I have not lost more w/diet and exercise. I refilled the 2nd month's rx today and was told by the nurse that once I lose an additional 8 lbs. I will not be able to get another rx. My ideal goal weight is 140-145#. If I am lucky enough to lose another 12 lbs within the next month I will still fall short of my goal. Some things I have figured out along the way: if you don't stay hydrated constantly and particularly while working outthis med can bring on headaches. Also, after about the second week I began getting hungry late at night. A few times it actually woke me up because I felt like I was starving. If I drank a cup of oj or ate a couple of nuts it would go away until the next day. I think that when the med was wearing off my body was trying to get me to eat more to meet the natural calorie setting that it has had for the past few years. All in all- I am pleased with my weight loss , the energy, and change in eating "mindset" that this rx has given me. Will report back in another month to see if I've met my goal.

column2: web-betty, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

Drink LOTS of water.)

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I'm 5'5". I started this med at 170# according to the doctor's scale. One week later I'm down to #162. I drink more water to compensate-which is better for me anyway.I don't sleep as much as I used to and sometimes have trouble falling asleep. I have tried restricting caffeine  to earlier in the day-before dinner-and this seems to help quite a bit. My goal weight is 145 #. I will post again at the end of the month to how close I am to reaching it. One thing I have noticed-I have always enjoyed/loved eating but since I have been on this I do not feel the same motivation to eat. Far fewer cravings and I eat much less than I normally would-WHEN I do actually eat. Hope this helps those of you just starting or thinking about starting this.

column2: Kay, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have an under active thyroid and have put on a ton of weight since having my little girl 3 three years ago ..Along with that I had depression and anxeity issues as well. The doctors put me on different appetite suppressants and they did not work that well at all.. With adipex I was put on the drug back in September of 07' and I have really been watching what I eat and honestly not even thinking about munching between meals like I used to ,and as of April 22nd I have dropped over 65 lbs. !!! I see the doctor every 5 to 6 weeks and she checks my heart and blood pressure and I have never felt more like myself... This medication is great but its really for people that are obese or have a substantial amount of weight to lose and it REALLY works very well ecspecially with watching what you eat  and calorie intake...  I am so glad that my doctor finally put me on something that gets the unwanted weight off..I don't have heart palpitations but it does give me energy and with an under active thyroid energy is really good..

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Ladies just to let you know what happened to me while taking the generic form of Adipex. If you are on ANY type of birth control, USE ALTERNATE FORMS OF CONTRACEPTIVES!! While on this Rx it made my birth control less effective. Not really sure what happend but I started 2 weeks earlier than what I was supposed to and I am very regular even before the pill. Not sure if there was a possible pregnancy or not but please what and be careful!

column2: Jerzey, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: This is my 3rd or 4th time being on adipex since 2002. Each time I took it it worked for me. The first time I took it in 2002, I lost 40 ponds in 3 months. At that time I was on a 1300/day calorie diet and I excersized regularly. Then I got pregnant! Go figure,LOL, So the following year I used it again but it was much more sporadic and I didn't excersize as often and I still lost about 10 pounds in a 3 month period. Last year I got married, and I wanted to lose some weight I had gained before the wedding so I tried it again and I was able to lose 20 pounds just with taking the pill and minimum-moderate excersize. So it does work. It's an appetite suppresent and a metobolic booster. Definitly take it as early in the day as possible because I found if I take it late, it keeps me up. If you are just starting would also take it every other day for the first week, so your body slowly builds up to tolerating it. If you have the tabs, I would also consider cutting the tabs in half to start out. Great drug, but it does not work alone, You have to try and work with it, Minimum you should be drinking a ton of water daily and try and at least do some sort of excersize, wether it's daily walks or a treadmill 3x per week. Oh sidenote...whenever I was on this pill and tried to eat junkfood "Mcdonalds" I got instantly sick. (diarhea) I would stay away from fast food. Hope this review helps! Good Luck!

column2: 19-24 Female
column9: All I'm asking is that you ladies be careful. Trust me, being overweight is terrible for your self-esteem and all, but it's not worth risking your life! This drug has been proved to cause heart damage and will more than likely be taken off the market in the very near future. My doctor recommended a drug called Meridia instead. It's also an appetite suppressant but doesn't contain phentermine so it's safer. Please, please, please be careful on this. I feel like we are all connected in some way and entitled to warn each othr about the dangers out there. So please, ask your doc to prescribe a different kind of suppressant.

column9: I started taking this med 3 weeks ago and have felt some of the side effets, but I wanted to give it a chance so I keep taking it and to my suprise I have lost 12 lbs in 3 weeks - the dry mouth went away 2 weeks after I started to take it - I started at 199 and now I am at 187 - I do not work out because I have 2 kids - a full time job - and can just never find the time - so I was so happy to see that the med does work even if you don't work out - I am going to try to start walking at night with my dogs and maybe it will help even more - but for all of you out there that are on this med I just want to say the effects don't last forever - if you can make it thru the first 2 weeks you will be very happy you did if - belive me I have a real hard time loosing weight no matter what I do - so for this to work its wonderful - if anyone wants to contact me feel free to email me at pattyatses@yahoo.com

column2: carebear77, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was nervous to take these pills at first because everything else I have tried never worked. Imagine my surprise to see the numbers shrinking on the scale after the very first week! I started taking them on April 1, 2008 & on May 1, 2008 I went back to my OBGYN and found that I had lost 18 1/2 pounds (with no excercise)!! I just started month 2 and have lost another 5 pounds. I began walking 2 1/2 - 3 miles on our high school track every night using my mp3 player to keep me going. I was diagnosed a year ago with PCOS (poly-cystic ovary syndrome)which has made it extremely hard to lose weight & has caused me to have ovulation/menstrual problems, but Adipex holds no grudges, lol. I can take Adipex in addition to taking Metformin (to help reduce the cysts) & prenatal vitamins with no side effects what so ever! I have lots of energy and can't wait to get my body back into shape & into my beloved jeans that have collected dust over the years. I have recommended this drug to several friends and family members & I will post another update soon.

column2: 19-24 Female  (Patient)
column9: All I'm asking is that you ladies be careful. Trust me, being overweight is terrible for your self-esteem and all, but it's not worth risking your life! This drug has been proved to cause heart damage and will more than likely be taken off the market in the very near future. My doctor recommended a drug called Meridia instead. It's also an appetite suppressant but doesn't contain phentermine so it's safer. Please, please, please be careful on this. I feel like we are all connected in some way and entitled to warn each othr about the dangers out there. So please, ask your doc to prescribe a different kind of suppressant.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I thought I would give an update.  Today is day 6 of my medication.  I have lost all appetite and have dropped 14 lbs.  I have been eating very little.  Last night I noticed an extreme change in urine color.  I called my doctor first thing this morning and she had me come in.  Just a heads up to you other users- the first few days or week you are on the medication, you drastically drop weight.  Your body is not hungry, you are not eatting, so your body is using fluids.  The first several pounds are just water loss.  If you do not eat SOMETHING....you will get dehydrated.  If your urine takes a drastic change in color--consumer water.  That was my problem.  I did not ever feel weak, but I was dehydrated.  She encouraged drinking at least 80 ozs of water a day & a little hint-if you feel like you may get hungry, drink water, it should give you a feeling of fullness.  Hope this helps!

column2: MommyWomen, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Ok I am 23yrs and I have two kids, well I gained a lot of weight after that. So I've been on it for three wks now and I can fit my old jeans now . YOU WILL lose the weight, but the side effects are really real the dry mouth, dizziness,blurred vision and dont wear glasses ok. Other than that every thing is all good -the price you pay to wear your old jeans.lol

I started taking Adipex 5 days ago. I have Anxiety/Stress issues so its naturally hard for me to loose weight. I have gained almost 20lbs in the last 2 years. I am only 22, and im 5'3. I weighed 154lbs when i was prescribed this, and im not going to weigh myself until i go back for my check up. Im also on Zoloft for my Anxiety, and the Adipex does not bother me or increase my anxeity symptoms at all. I dont really have any side effects other than i dont sleep long at all. Im lucky to get 4-6 hours a night. I literally have to make myself eat, so its easy to eat healthy. I dont have dry mouth, but i am thirsty alot. You could set anything in front of me, and i really dont want to eat. Theres no temptation. Iv been working out doing cadrio at least 3-4 times a week, for 25-45 minutes. Iv noticed a little difference in my jeans already. So far im satisfied, i just hope the weight comes off fast, and helps me continue eating small portions even after im off of this medication.

column9: I first started taken adipex in January of 08 and didnt go on the scale until I went back 2 the doctors I was 309 and when I had my weigh in I lost 15 pounds first month.Now only side affects dry mouth but u just drink lots of water chew sugarless gum.A lil hard time sleepin but everything else was fine my doctor was so proud.Now I do work full time and always moving but I also coach basketball and love to go and shoot hoops with the girls on my days off.I would recommend anyone who would like to try dont buy online go to ur doctor so u know ur getting better care in case god for bid its not for u please ask ur doctor.Now my second monthly visit still didnt go on the scale at home I waited I think its best anyway and I lost another 10 pounds amazing.Im getting ready for my 3rd month visit the 19th of this month.I feel more energy not as much back pain or knee pains and just want to be healthy I wanna be down to at least 180 to 200 pounds im 5'7 and I never really looked 300 pounds but I felt it and saw it with my clothes off.Im a borderline diabetic and it runs in my family and I want to stop from any of it getting worse now.Good Luck to u all and please see a doctor.

column2: ALAUNIE75, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this medication for 3 weeks now and have lost 10 lbs (average 3lbs week). i don't follow the 1200 calorie diet except when i don't hit the gym then i am around 1500 when i do go and eat 5 times a day. i do about 1 hr cardio 5 days a week and do not take the medication about 2 x's a week~usually when i am not going to the gym. i have found that i am very thirsty but gum & powerade options seem to help a lot. i cannot drink only water all day. the only time i feel off is if i don't eat when i should. i do wake up a couple times during the night but do not have trouble going back to sleep. i love that it gives me energy in the am when i have to wake early. i would definately recommend this but be careful of side effects, make sure you are well informed and to listen to your body. i also use myfooddiary.com to record my meals & exercise. it is great for reports and to let you know how you are doing. it also helps keep me accountable and see where i am going wrong if i am not seeing the results that i want. it is only $9 a month~ great site.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a 27 year old female and this is my 3rd month on this drug. So far I've lost about 29 lbs. After my 2nd child I was having major trouble with cravings (mainly sweets) Now I don't think about them at all (except maybe when P.M.S.ing)  When I do eat I get fuller faster and never finish a meal.  That never happened before!  My doc perscribed 37.5 mg once daily.  The 1st week was terrible!  I didn't think I could stay on it.  I felt like I was on speed.  I could not turn my brain off.  I only got about 2 hrs of sleep a night that 1st week.  It's much better now, I can usually get at least 4 hrs.  I was a nap person, but can't do that with this.  I also have problems with constipation, however I have always had problems with that.  The dry mouth is terrible, but not always consistant.  I have found that no amount of water helps, but chewing gum does.  There is also a lack of interest for sex, but again another area that I have had problems with.  I have about 10-15 more lbs to lose.  I hope to do that this month because the doc only perscribed 3 mos worth.  Overall I think the med is great.  After my 1st child I lost 30 lbs on weight watchers, however this time was different.  The cravings were terrible.  I can deal with being hungry but not the cravings!

Like a constant hangover headache. column2: slpblair@yahoo.com, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Ive been taking adipex for 6wks,lost 10 lbs in the 1st 4. Ive always been overweight. I gain slowly but lose even slower,until i tried this. I take it 1xdaily  abt 1-2hrs alftr my 1st meal, which could be 9am or 2pm. I drive a trk so my excerise consist of, walking in the mall,taking the stairs when possible and dancing to my fav. cd (avg 15-20mins nonstop). The 1wk im home im always on the go running errons or visiting. I was loseing wait B4 useing this but avg had been about 10 lbs a yr,same routine LESS moderate though. I eat what i want (nvr liked diet,lowcal,fat or sugar free anything)just less often and less of it.(i.e. happy meals vs.#5 @whataburger, 1 brkfast sandwich w/jelly vs. 2eggs/4bacon/2toast, 45ozs water daily vs. 45wkly+avg of 14cans of 7up,kickn the daily 5stx of juicy fruit gum, 1bag of chips wkly vs.3 and lastly 7 hotwings im full vs. 10+med fry) Because i was already kickn some of my unneccesary eatn and snackn, im motivated to do even better. I dont smoke,abuse drugs,avg 6 margaritas a yr and i dont go to bed w/in 2hrs of eatn however i do eat as much ice cream as i like(avg 3xwkly-cones or bars only) So having said all of that im 5'4/265, goal is 150-160 w/in nxt 2yrs. Im not gonna depend on this drug but while i have it, ive decided to step up changes that i feel would be easist to maintain. I would recommend this medication and intend to keep useing it for @ least the rest of '08. I hope these details will help anyone considering or useing adipex..(feel free to email)..Good Luck!

column2: Good2BAngie, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I started out at a 258 lbs in June, at about 37 BMI, and have lost 50 lbs to date (so 50 lbs in 6.5 mos).  You don't even think about food.. I have to remind myself to get nutrition.  I keep cals within 1200/day and exercise at least 3x/wk (usually walk on treadmill 2.5-3mph for 45 mts).  Does not make me wired, cause insomnia, etc whatsoever. Amazing stuff.  I think I'll be able to sustain my weight after I'm off of adipex, because it's helped me to change my eating habits by making calorie-management sustainable for the long-term by keeping me on my diet... cause I keep losing weight and it is inspiring.  It gives you a reason to "keep at it" if you're losing, and the longer you keep on your diet plan and keep losing and keep exercising and keep watching what you eat (with an occasional splurge) ... it becomes a new routine.  A GOOD new habit... eating for sustenance and health, not entertainment or fulfillment.

column2: Tim, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took this drug for one month in August of 2007.  The first week I never thought about eating.  After that, it took a little effort on my part, but very little.  My appetite was much smaller the entire month on the drug.  I lost 15 pounds that month.  I just started taking it again, 3 days ago.  Again, I do not even think about eating.  I expect the effectiveness to slowly decrease throughout the month as before.  I am not taking it again due to a return of the lost weight, but because I have stopped losing weight on my own and have been stagnant for two months.  I highly recommend this medicine as a "booster" for people who are putting forth a good effort to lose weight on their own.  I have lost 40 pounds in nine months.  15 pounds of it was during one month on the medication.  The rest was at a rate of about 4 pounds a month without it.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I've been taking Adipex off and on for 9 months now.  My fiance lost over 80lbs while taking this drug.  His sister-in-law-45lbs, his brother 60lbs, and his sister-30lbs! I stopped taking it for almost 2 months after losing 20lbs, and gained every ounce back, while maintaining the same diet.  Exercise is key to this drug.  It isn't a miracle drug, but it definitely assists in the fight to be healthier!  I would recommend it to anyone who has tried everything else to no avail.
